Reviews.Title: “More like a motel than a hotel, but overall okay”
Reviews.Author: sea2skyaus
Reviews.Content: Pros: -Reasonably good location. It's 2 minute walk to Canal Street (trams), 5 minute walk to Bourbon street (nightlife) and 15 minute walk to the heart of the French Quarter -Quiet street -Close to shops and pharmacies (2 minute walk) -Free internet Cons -More like a motel than a hotel. Some rooms have no exterior windows. -Interior decor and carpet are dated. -Wifi internet dropped out for hours during my stay. -Probably first hotel I stayed at that sheets are not ironed Overall: Good for its price but probably would not stay there again. It's good of its price though.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: T13
Reviews.Content: When we got to the hotel to check in, it looked just liked the pictures. Very pretty lobby and design. Definitely can tell it used to be a department store (in a good way). I immediately asked the person at check-in about the smell (told him I read reviews about it) and requested a room without the issue. He said ok and told me that he thinks they resolved the problem. We didn't have any odor issues in our room (room 429). The room was a little small but adequate and clean. Nice Bath & Body Works toiletries. We didn't have any issues with hot water at all. It is true that there are no outside windows for king rooms. It wasn't really a problem for us but it was very easy to oversleep in the morning and lose track of time so just set your alarm. Yes, the walls were pretty thin but we didn't have too many issues with noise at all. It was pretty quiet. The location was FANTASTIC!!!! That's the best thing about this hotel. Within walking distance of everything (Bourbon Street, River Walk, etc.) but far enough away that you didn't have to deal with the noise at night. The walk also seemed pretty safe. I would suggest riding the Magazine St streetcar/trolley through the Garden District and to the Audubon Zoo and Park. The zoo was great. Bourbon Street is exactly what you imagine if you've never been there. A big frat party with bad smells but good for drinks and people watching. Most of the venues on Bourbon Street are more like nightclubs with party music. If you want jazz bands your best bet is to walk to some other places in the French Quarter off of Bourbon. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant...there are too many great places to eat in NOLA. Oceana Restaurant on Conti St was probably our favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Nice New Orleans Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ElusiveCher
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice but the parking was horrible and confusing. The hotel staff was excellent and the rooms were nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, quiet”
Reviews.Author: LakeLoafer
Reviews.Content: When we checked in, the staff was very helpful and got me some information I wanted. The room was clean with a separate sitting area. The bed was very comfortable. Room was quiet and dark when sleeping. Only a couple of blocks from the French Quarter. You can self park for only $20 per night which is a bargain in NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: raymond b
Reviews.Content: this is a wonderfull hotel. staff very friendly and helpfull awsome location very clean and very comfortable . you are just 5 minutes walking to the french quarter and burbon st. take the street car down canal st it connects you everywhere I would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Would NOT stay here again”
Reviews.Author: traveling_via_ATL
Reviews.Content: We have not had a good experience at this hotel. We found the service to be cold and unfriendly, and we found both the common areas and our room to be in disrepair. Our bathroom had mildew, and there was a very noticeable cigarette burn in our furniture. The interior walls of the hotel are generally not clean, and common amenities - such as the ice maker or luggage carts - were out of order or unavailable. We had an exterior facing room, so location of our room did not impact our rating of this hotel. The hotel is well below our expectations for a three-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great bed, Lousy towels”
Reviews.Author: LaurieLoves2Travel
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 5 nights at this hotel. It gets great pluses for being in one of the best locations. A 2 block walk to catch the trolley and a 3 block walk to the French Quarter. It was also an easy walk to the Civil War and WW2 Museums. The beds were so comfy and they have room darkening shades which helped when needing to nap after an early flight into town. The one big drawback is the towels which are about the worst I've ever had in a hotel. This is what keeps the rating at 3 stars for me. The bathroom as well as the shampoo, conditioner, and lotion were fine so I'm not sure why they scrimped on the towels. The hotel also has a fitness room but it's very limited in size with 1 treadmill, 2 bikes, and 2 stair machines. The treadmill was broken and one of the bikes had a broken seat that would not lock in place. I also had trouble getting hot water on the first day, but the maintenance man came to my room and fixed the problem. They have a coffee shop which serves Starbucks coffee but in terms of hotel bar or restaurant, this hotel is very no frills. There's a Sushi restaurant next door which has a separate entrance from the street but you can also get to it through the hotel lobby. Unfortunately, it wasn't really a good bar-type atmosphere but the French Quarter was filled with all kinds of options for that! It was nice to have free Wi-fi. It seems so many hotels charge you for this these days.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: MassillonJill
Reviews.Content: Right on St. Charles, the Wyndham Plaza was across the street from the streetcar and all attractions the French Quarter holds. We had a studio apartment with plenty of room, a spacious bathroom, refrigerator, dishwasher and cooktop. The kitchen was not lavishly furnished; what's the use of a cooktop if you have no pots and pans? Two glasses, two plates, two knives, forks, and spoons; it would be hard to vacation with such sparse supplies. But the decor was lovely; the init was obviously recently decorated. The price about as reasonable as you can get in the French Quarter. These are time shares; I'd steer clear of the usual high-pressure sales pitch. The pool was very small; don't count on getting much exercise in it. It's purely for cooling off.

Reviews.Title: “My stay was perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: Barbara A
Reviews.Content: Seldom do you find a hotel that offers a perfect location, value, history, cleanliness and top notch hospitality from every staff member, all bundled into one. This was the wow factor! I was there for six days on a business convention and each day was pure pleasure. Each and every person who worked at this property was professional, helpful and accommodating. I hope that Wyndham sends me a customer comment card because I wrote down every person's name who helped make my stay one of the best times I have had in over 25 years of travel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: LacySpikes
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very good location, close to everything , but not right in the middle of the crowds .I don't like the French decor that a lot of the New Orleans hotels have, and this hotel had a nice and modern look. Pretty close to all the bars and shopping. The bathroom was huge , with a nice stand up shower with great water pressure. The beds were nice and comfy. I had a room facing the inside corridor so there was no balcony or window, but I knew that before booking..

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Keep Expectations In Check”
Reviews.Author: hmelawyer
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that the location is wonderful. One block from Canal Street/Bourbon Street corner. You can be on Bourbon Street in just a few minutes, but do not have the noise to deal with when you finally decide to get some rest. The rooms were clean and adequate and I wouldn't hesitate to stay at this hotel again if I was headed to New Orleans. TVs and fridge were new, and bathroom had nice granite finishes. Now for the complaints: the parking garage will not accommodate an SUV and they will make you park at a non-affiliated garage about a block away, that will give you some security concerns for your vehicle. When I envision a suite I expect some true division between the living area and the sleeping area. The actual division of the "suite" was a see-through latticed wall for only half of the room width and provided no true division between the areas. Further, the room had no exterior window. At nearly $400/night, I expected a little bit more. However, while I will look at other options next time I head to the Big Easy I will also keep this hotel on my list of options.

Reviews.Title: “Gem Just Off the French Quarter!”
Reviews.Author: visuality
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed here several times b/c it is a great value. Located just a block from the French Quarter, this renovated art deco, former Sears store is beautiful. The staff is very friendly and helpful, and the rooms are attractive, clean, and have flat-screen TVs and work desks with nearby outlets. Only quibble is towels could have been larger and fluffier.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location And At A Fair Price”
Reviews.Author: Mizzou71
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good value for a high cost city. Do not expect room service, or other high end extras. The room is quiet, basic, clean and roomy with acceptable but not great lighting. The bedding is wonderful. The room service without issue. The location is within easy walking of The French Quarter, Casino and Shopping. Warning - If you want a room with a window you have to request request it. Our room had an interior window which surprised us but we did not care. We used the room to sleep/fresh-up and not to host anything. . Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you want to be close to the Quarter but not in it.”
Reviews.Author: redrhodes
Reviews.Content: Easy to access from Canal. Great location. Parking garage was scary with my mini van but doable!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Clean”
Reviews.Author: H_Edgar86
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a pretty good value. It's a convenient distance to Borboun street, Jackson square, and lot of shopping. it's quiet and clean. If you want a room with a window you had better request it. Our room had an interior window which was kind of weird. But who cares...it's clean, nice and has comfortable bedding.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tenoch
Reviews.Content: This place was CLEAN and we were upgraded for free to a suite. Comfortable bed and walking distance to everything. It could not have been any easier getting around. Parking is below the hotel in a very small basement garage. Arrive early to get a spot. It is also 20 dollars to park per day.

Reviews.Title: “A great value”
Reviews.Author: MontessoriMom3
Reviews.Content: I couldn't have had a better stay excepting the parking which was a really tight squeeze in an SUV. I have a Honda Pilot so I barely made it into the parking lot entrance. After the exit and entry, it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Did we have a great stay??”
Reviews.Author: Marlamstev
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time. Our room was very clean, we had plenty enough towels, beds were very comfy! We plan on staying here again on our next visit. Oh, we never had to wait on an elevator!!

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: Wes B
Reviews.Content: The price was pretty competitive, but other than that this hotel was average at best. The room didn't seem very clean and our window overlooked the inside of the hotel. I recommend requesting an outdoor viewing window if you stay here. Also, after giving us a very stern warning that smoking in the room would result in a $250 fee, we entered the first room they tried to give us and were overcome with the smell of smoke. However, they were very accommodating in giving us a new room. In addition, our stool was very loose and almost felt as if it wasn't attached to the ground, which isn't critical but is a simple maintenance issue they should fix. In summary, it's not terrible, but you are getting what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tp5970
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here during the weekend right after Mardi Gras 12'. This was a decent place to stay, and was just ok. The bedding was nice. The staff was nice. But this place lacked the pizazz that other hotels offer in the heart of the French Quarter. We slept 4 to a room which was pushing it. The standard rooms are midsized, and don't have an abundant amount of storage. The decor was ok, but slightly out of date. The staff was really nice and everything was fairly clean. It is off the strip, so you will have to do some walking to get to Bourbon St./The French Quarter. I recommend this place if you are to use it for business purposes, or if it is just a couple of friends, but if you are looking for a romantic get away, this is definately not the place to go. The hotel offers undergroud parking, and has a small snack bar in the lobby. They also offer a banquet hall.

Reviews.Title: “The Good...the Bad and the Ugly...”
Reviews.Author: PrincessWildhair
Reviews.Content: Well, if I were traveling hoping to have a romantic and cozy weekend in New Orleans...this is NOT your hotel...if you are traveling with kids, cheerleaders, teenagers, college students on spring break...well you may have found your place. 1. The good - Location, nice and helpful staff, nice bathrooms, interesting Art Deco architecture building 2. The bad - NO restaurant on the premises for room service for those of us who travel for work. There is a Japanese restaurant downstairs but pass on it if you actually like Japanese food. If you are a man...or most women...the towels are small...they are not going around you...(just sayin!) The hotel is large and clearly Wyndham seems to be missing the funds to really make it nice...it appear worn but no too bad. Pillows...well there are a lot of them and the beds aren't bad but the pillows are high and hard...hard... 3. The ugly - o.k. If you want a Kind room you are NOT going to have a window to look anywhere...and well there is NOTHING to see from this hotel anyway. I mean NO windows!!! There is a window but it faces the inside of the hotel in the hallway. If you are a person who doesnt pay attention to the curtains being closed...well you might think about it. Elevators is right out of Tower of Terror!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: pgillin0734
Reviews.Content: It's a great time to visit New Orleans, not just because it is a fantastic city that needs all the help it can get but also because the drop-off in tourism following Hurricane Katrina has made it one of the great travel values in the US. Traveling on a business trip, I got this room in a prime spot near the French Quarter for $84 per night and it was a very good value for the price. The pros: The Wyndham Garden is clean, centrally located and has a good range of standard business travel facilities, including a well-equipped workout room and good - if not great - Wi-Fi performance. The king-size bed in my room was quite soft, which is not ideal if you have a bad back, but the down comforter was a great touch. There are excellent restaurants within just a couple blocks and Bourbon Street is a five-minute walk, if you're into that scene. Personally, I'd just as soon avoid the tourist meccas and explore some of the lovely parks and beautiful architecture around the French Quarter. Those are also a short walk. The cons: A lot of the rooms at the Wyndham Garden face inward, making it impossible to tell whether it's day or night. I love a plush towel, and the bath towels at the Wyndham were surprisingly chintzy and small. My room was also freezing. Even with the air conditioning set at the highest temperature, I doubt the room got much above 68Â°. I couldn't figure out how to make the alarm clock work and the face isn't illuminated, making it impossible to read at night. In short, the cons are pretty minor, and considering what you pay for a downtown room at most U.S. tourist destinations, the Wyndham was a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms near French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Carol202
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate on a Sunday night. Much better than other nice hotels in the area. Room was very large and bathroom much larger than most. We had a room with two double beds and no outside window. It was quiet and dark which is OK if you want to sleep in. If you spend a lot of time in the room it would feel claustrophobic. Staff very nice and everything was as expected. Very short walk to Bourbon St. Self parking $20, which is less than many area hotels charge. I would return here for a short stay as long as I didn't have to pay the higher weekend rate.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing stay in every way, surprising luxury”
Reviews.Author: Edgetheow
Reviews.Content: During a recent New Orleans visit, I shared a room at Baronne Plaza with my dad. It was a large, comfortable room, with an excellent TV, and the most comfortable bedding I can recall. Full, clean, fresh down comforters, outstanding pillows, a luxuriant bathroom, and a superb AC/heater system made this hotel worth the stay. Location was top notch, although not directly in the French Quarter. Very nice stay, incredibly enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Worse experience ever”
Reviews.Author: Eduardo C
Reviews.Content: Is the first time in my life that I stayed in a ho tel that they haven make my room with the excuse t hat the housekeeper already left. I leave my room at 12:30 pm and returned at 6:00pm and they didnt do the cleaning of my room and I request the servi ce and the reception told me the cant do it. Is un believable this happen to me in the hotel, and th e even worse I request clean towels and they they told me the cant either send me the clean towels. The worse hote experience ever in my life.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: GCTiger
Reviews.Content: We got a junior suite with a king bed. Very quiet room with a comfortable bed. Great location, near the uptown parades, near the Quarter and one block from Canal. The staff was great and helpfull to the guest. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great price, great location!!”
Reviews.Author: lisalashe
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night and I was very happy with the hotel. It's about a block from Bourbon St., but very quiet. The hotel allowed us to check in early and check out late, a major plus!! The staff was very friendly and made the stay comfortable. We were given a room with a view of Canal St. However, many room have an interior view (windows face inside the hotel). There is only a sushi restaurant inside the hotel, but there's plenty of variety within walking distance. There was no fridge in each room, but we brought a cooler and ice machines are conveniently located on each floor. I would highly recommend this hotel as an alternative to Wyndham Chateau Bourbon which is currently under construction. You won't be dissappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Class Act in downtown New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Rod B
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the New Orleans area through Chalmetta and saw a mass of damage still remaining after Katrina. But, when we arrived at our hotel, which had been flooded during the hurricane, we found a magnificant facility. Ever inch of the hotel had been remodeled and the atrium/lobby was beautiful. The staff was great, starting at the curb, to the desk, to the room, to the on site parking and to every staff member. This is truly a class act in the Big Easy. Signs in the city say "'Dat' Tourist is Important" and at the Wyndham Barrone Garden Plaza they really follow that sloggan and mean it.

Reviews.Title: “1 block from French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night to explore the french quarter and bourbon street areas. The hotel was nice and conveniently located, just a short walk to bourbon street and attractions. The staff was pleasant and helpful. Will definitely return to this hotel for future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet rooms, good value”
Reviews.Author: trvlgrlsanjose_CaUSA
Reviews.Content: One thing I hate when traveling is to hear other guests through thin hotel walls. This has to be the quietest hotel I can remember. I did not hear another guest during my week long stay. The room was clean, the bed very comfortable. the location is great, 2blocks from the French Quarter, one block from 2 streetcar lines. Service was good. when I checked in, my room was not ready, so the desk clerk gave me a voucher for a free breakfast. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good price.”
Reviews.Author: SanZoe
Reviews.Content: The hotel really is in a good location, and for the weekday price we paid we couldn't have asked for much more. (On a Saturday, however, the price jumped by more than $150, and so for that night we relocated to a nearby 4-star property that was less expensive.) I do wish that I had read previous reviews more closelyâ€”I wasn't aware there would be no outside windows. There was, however, a window into the hallway/hotel interior. It would be nice for business traveling, as it made the room incredibly dark and quiet; but for the tourist it offers no view. I found the room to be very clean and comfortable. There was a lack of attention to some of the smaller details: the interior door lock was was loose, and an arm on the desk chair was also very loose, for example. I found the staff to be friendly and helpful. Overall it was a good experience, and I would certainly stay there again if looking to save a little on lodging.

Reviews.Title: “Nice art-deco hotel but with some flaws”
Reviews.Author: Mrtsadventure
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights. Overall, we enjoyed our stay. The hotel is a 1930s artdeco building with a nice lobby. The staff were friendly and very welcoming when we arrived. We had a standard king room. The room was clean and the bedding was very nice. The location was about a 5 minute walk to all the action on Bourbon Street. As other reviewers have mentioned, the room does not have an outside window. When I booked the hotel, I didn't think this would be a big deal but when dealing with some inclement weather over the past few days, it would've been nice to be able to look out the window to see if it was raining. Also, by not having a window to the outside, it made the small room feel a little claustrophobic. The walls are also pretty thin. I was woken up by the couple next door at 4am...needless to say, I could hear "everything" that was going on!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Spot”
Reviews.Author: WarmVacations
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a SWAir special fare and hotel. I was surprised how close it was to Bourbon Street (1 block from Canal St, another block to Bourbon). It is the site of one of 6 hotels built in New Orleans during the 1930's and was a Sears Department Store before converting to a Hotel. Just across the street is one of the oldest churches (Jesuit) in downtown. The hotel is surrounded by tall commercial buildings with no dark alleys to Canal St. People/Staff are helpful, friendly, and try to please. The price is very attractive for the location. The hotel rooms are interesting because they are inside the building, with windows viewing the inside not the outside. If you open up the window curtains, you will see the windows of other rooms on several floors. The rooms are well appointed, with flat panel TV's and a soft bed. Free USA Today's are available at the front desk. The restaurant is a sushi restaurant that was reasonably priced. For the price, the hotel is a good value. My negatives start with hot water. It took over 4 minutes at full throttle to get hot water both in the tub and sink. I called the front desk, who were very accommodating and understanding, and they gave me the choice to move or wait for maintenance to fix it. I waited, but it still did not work. No blame, just what happens when you have a room without many people on the floor getting up early. Also, the door did not close tightly, so I have to make sure the door was totally closed and locked before I locked it. I was awoken twice in the middle of the night (1am & 3am) as people coming back from festivities were banging on their doors to be let in for bed. Then they would turn on the TV loudly.. so you can hear neighbors two rooms down. I would stay again, but maybe request a room away from traffic. I read the other reviews and I agree with the positives.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite place to stay in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: michelleluvsmax
Reviews.Content: My family and my brother in law's family stayed here for a weekend in January. We loved it.Check-in was a breeze. We even requested a late check-out the next day, and were given one. We had a full suite. We fit two couples with our small children very comfortable. The beds were very comfortable. The bathroom was spacious. The rooms as well as the lobby were clean and well decorated,What makes this hotel the best is the LOCATION! You are a less than 5 minute walk from Canal Street which has shopping, restaurants and the streetcar. You are close to the action but far away enough from the noise. We always felt very safe. We even were close enough to walk to the Superdome. This will be our new go-to hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay there again!!”
Reviews.Author: Sharon K
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at the hotel and I can only have good things to say. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The noise level was nil. The front desk was wonderful and very helpful. Location was perfect - close enough but not too close. We could walk everywhere. Only complaint - we never were able to get a newspaper until the morning we left. This one we picked up at 5:45 AM. I look forward to visiting this property again.

Reviews.Title: “good location but no windows in room”
Reviews.Author: WineLover0717
Reviews.Content: This hotel is outside the French Quarter - just a few blocks walk through busy safe streets to get over there. This was my first visit to New Orleans and at first I wanted to book a hotel in the French Quarter near Bourbon Street - but I am VERY glad I did not. Bourbon Street is loud!! This hotel is large and clean and the front desk staff were VERY nice and accomodating. They were helpful friendly and patient every time we asked for recommendations, directions or even just help with something. The cleaning staff were also helpful and accomodating - this was a girls weekend and 3 girls shared a suite so we asked for extra bedding for the pull out sofa, extra towels, etc and it was never an issue and very prompt. Like I said in the title, we had an indoor room which only looked in to the interior of the hotel. The window was in to the hallway. I tend to like natural light but other than that it was also too easy to sleep late (after a late night out...) with no light for us to realize it was daytime! But that was the only issue. The room was spacious enough and the bathroom was huge!! (good for 3 girls!). The pull out bed was not that comfortable.. very firm.. but the regular beds were quite nice. Downstairs was a little coffee/bakery place and a sushi restaurant. We didn't take advantage of either but nice to know it was there. I would stay here again. The price was also very reasonable!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: JFromHouston
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but great things to say about staying at this hotel. The room was the smallest I've been in but it was clean and neat and the bed was SO comfortable. If it matters to you, having a room with a view might not be possible since the hotel is surrounded by tall buildings (Our window faced the interior of the hotel). The staff was nice and helpful. And the location was the best part! Me and my boyfriend literally walked EVERYWHERE the whole weekend. It's 2 blocks from Canal Street with the French Quarter in very short walking distance. It's also located to where you can reasonably walk to the Riverwalk Marketplace, Harrah's and other locations in the Downtown/Central Business District Area and 3-4 blocks away from St. Charles where you can hop on the streetcar to the Garden District, ect. Parking would be my only issue but it's worth it since its easier to just walk everywhere than to drive and try to find parking. It is an EXTRA TIGHT space getting around down there (It's under the hotel) so if you have a large truck or SUV OR if you're not so good at parking, you might want to check with the hotel on whether your vehicle will fit or make sure you get there early to get a easy parking space. Overall, I will definitely stay here again! The usual rate is $100+ night but we found a Papa Noel (Christmas) rate online for $55+ a night. Christmas time is great time to head to New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Francis C
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying the front desk staff was great! I am not sure what the smell was in my room but it was awful I asked to change rooms and when I did the next room had the exact same odor. The bed looked comfortable but truly was not, had the worst sleep ever. I should have been told when I made the reservation that the window overlooked the hallway, no natural light at all and had to keep the curtain closed so people in the hall could look in. I have stayed in many Wyndham hotels and none even came close to this, not sure how is it apart of the Wyndham chain.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but average quality”
Reviews.Author: amedvedovski
Reviews.Content: First of all, the hotel has excellent location, which is 2 blocks from French quarter. Unfortunately the room tht we had did not have any outside windows. It had windows facing the hallway where people go, so we could not open curtains. Also when I requested a taxi, which has credit cards processing, from reception we got a taxi without it. Basically in the hotel they forgot to request it from taxi company. Our rooms was not cleaned. We found dirt and some small items from previous guests. In our last day a cleaning person left her chemicals in our room.

Reviews.Title: “clean and decent choice”
Reviews.Author: kamitravel
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here and we liked it. This hotel is just a short walk away from the French quarter. Lobby is nice with very high ceilings. Most of the rooms don't have a view to outside and will open to the atrium. I was expecting to have a noisy atrium but fortunately it's very well quiet. Our room was clean and the furniture were all in good shape. Bathroom was nice and clean. There was no fridge in the room, but coffee maker and the TV with basic channels were enough for us. The air conditioner in the room was making the room feel damp and humid and we turned it off. I am not sure how this will treat you in summer though. They provide you with a free wireless password. I didn't try it so I cannot comment on the speed. Business center had 3 PCs with decent speed. Parking will cost extra, but still it's cheaper than many places in quarter. Pros: being close to the French quarter, price, clean room Cons: the walk from quarter at night can be creepy. This is your typical chain-type, no surprise hotel. If you are looking for a decent place close to quarter without paying the premium to quarter hotels, it can be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: Kevin W
Reviews.Content: Spend a weekend there back in February. Looked at the reviews and it was rated positively. Booked a suite because we wanted something a litle nicer. Check in went great. Got to the room and opened the door. The room smelled like it had not had fresh air in a few months and had been wet. Smelt like 100 year old carpet in a basement that gets wet all the time. There must have been some water damage as the room had recently been repaired. The room was nice but the smell ruined it. We went to the front desk and asked to be moved. Unfortunately we had to go to the closet pharmacy and purchase sprays and air freshners. Even with that we could still smell the musty ordor. We were there for 3 nights. By the 2nd and 3rd night the smell was manageable. When I checked out I asked to speak to the manager on duty as the previous days there was nobody. We were given the contact information to the GM. Emailed the hotel and never heard a word. A day or so later I receive a survey from Wyndham. Completed it poorly but once again not a response. For that reason I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “not impressed”
Reviews.Author: prisky
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. We arrived before the check-in time and they were able to find a room for us which was great. Front desk staff were quick to check us in and helpful with questions I had about the area. The room was very small! It had a king sized bed, a desk, wardrobe, large flat screen TV. Unfortunately it didn't have a spot to place our suitcase. For some reason it had a window facing the inside of the hotel. I found that quite strange. It's not like we could open our blinds as everyone that walked past could see in. The good: location is great. Very close to the French Quarter and other tourist attractions. The Internet had good signal and speed was good. Lots of channels available on the TV. The bad: room is very small, it felt a little claustrophobic. No breakfast. Parking was $20 p/ night. Bed at first appeared comfortable, but we ended up having an awful 2 nights. The mattress protector was too small and kept moving around. The mattress wasn't supportive enough. No fridge or microwave in the room. I did have higher exceptions for a 3 star hotel. Next time I'm in NOLA I will try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel while working in New Orleans and I wish I would have known about this place earlier. i had been working in NOLA for almost a month bouncing from a condo to hotels back and forth. My company secretary was booking the hotels and it was hit and miss. I stayed here my last weekend and it was one of the best stays. There beds are like clouds I also had my credit card stolen and they were helpful with me just putting a cash deposit down. Not only is the hotel really nice and affordable but the staff went above and beyond. i can remember the lady who helped me at the from desk but she was great! It very close to everything! Cant wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay minutes from the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: natauc
Reviews.Content: We were there in October with a group of Acadians visiting everything Cajun in New Orleans. It was nice to be so close to the French quarter, just 5 minutes away. The room was a bit small for 3 people, but we managed just fine. What I particularly liked about this this was that the sink area wasn't in the bathroom so if someone was taking a shower, another person should get ready and use a sink too. It was a bit rowdy on the Saturday night that we were there, I had 2 random people knocking on the door, drunk, not knowing who they were pretty much! Besides that, we really enjoyed our stay :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, some foul odors”
Reviews.Author: r1tripper
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location, basically 2 blocks from French Quarter. The room was comfortable, spacious, clean and beds were comfortable. The problem we had was a funky odor in our room 232, my son said it smelled like cat litter. I smelled a perfume smell over sewage. We complained about the room after sleeping in it one night. They gave us 234, right next door. It did not have an odor at the time. When we came back that afternoon it smelled of a strong sewage smell. I talked to the cleaning lady who was cleaning 232 (which still had the funky smell and was apparently being prepared for next unlucky guest) and she had front desk call me. They then gave me a room on third floor which we stayed in the next two nights odor free. I feel this is a problem that they know about but chose not to or are unable to remedy, then try to pass it off to whomever they can. The staff was very helpful with the problem and did their best to accomodate. We had to move two times and had a very unrestful night 1st night but were too exhausted after driving all day and a late night out to dinner to complain initially. I thought there would be a comp of some sort for our troubles, but there was not. Parking was tight, but adequate and to be expected for New Orleans. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: khazzaxo
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights in this hotel and had a pleasant stay. Rooms were very clean which is always a plus, not to mention free wifi :).. The best thing about this place is the location .. street walk from main Canal Street not to mention 2 blocks from Bourboun Street :) .. assured to return!

Reviews.Title: “Decent moderately-priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: disneyflgirl
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3-night stay. We booked a double room with exterior view online a few months prior, but when we arrived, we were told there weren't any exterior rooms available and were instead given an interior "suite." Although I was disappointed there was no outside window, the room was large, with a sitting area, two flat screen TV's, comfortable beds with plenty of pillows, and an oversized bathroom with separate garden tub and shower. Biggest complaint is that we heard lots of noise while trying to sleep: rowdy football fans returning from a Saints game, people in the next room talking and laughing loudly at 3am (not to mention that whenever they flushed their toilet or used their sink, it sounded like a jackhammer and the walls literally shook). I've stayed at the Baronne at least 5 times over the years, and this was my favorite room, but was disappointed at the noise factor. New Orleans is by no means a "quiet city," but you should expect that once you retreat to your hotel room, you should have some peace and quiet. Also, our room had a slight musty smell. Friends staying in a different room said the same thing, and also said their AC unit was incredibly loud. With that being said, If you're looking for a decent hotel in the CBD, within walking distance to the French Quarter, and you don't want to break the bank, then this is a great hotel. No major frills, but it'll do the job.

Reviews.Title: “Best sleep! Would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: HirschAustralia
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location, walking distance from Bourbon Street, the riverfront area and the French Quarter. Easy to get around New Orleans by foot, day and night. With a small group of friends. Just off the main street, quiet at night. Rooms were mid sized, clean. Minimal furniture to get in the way. Very, VERY, comfortable bed, heaps of pillows: one of the best sleeps I had in the states! Flat screen TV, free wifi made it even better. Nice, clean bathroom; room overlooked the street. Great reception area, very modern looking. Easy to navigate into and around town from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in a decent location”
Reviews.Author: Montana_Sailor
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed there for a week and was pleased overall. The rooms are large and clean. Fan was surprisingly quiet. No washer or dryer however there was a same day affordable laundry service. The exercise room was substandard. The treadmill, one recumbent bike and on stepmaster were broken. That meant I had to schedule my workouts for offpeak times. All in all, a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very cool lobby”
Reviews.Author: DASH1965
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the early part of December with my 20 something daughter. Room was perfect, minimal furniture setup made moving around the room wonderful. Beds were comfy with tons of pillows. As with all old hotels in Nola it takes the hot water awhile to reach the bathroom but nice and hot once it got there. The location was basically 2 blocks to Bourbon in the business district area.

Reviews.Title: “decent, convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: mahleen
Reviews.Content: this hotel has a big lobby. staff is helpful. room is clean. beds and linens are the best. the mattresses are not too firm nor soft, just right. i don't like a mattress that's too soft. i have a back problem, so am very picky with my mattress. we had double beds room. i like the hallways, it's different from other typical hotel. very convenient to canal and bourbon street. you can take the street car on canal (one block, last stop, so it's convenient that u can choose ur seat), for $1.25(one way), or $3.00 all day (if u want to come back for meals at the restaurant areas) no free breakfast. free wifi and it's ok. we were on the 5th floor. the location of the hotel is nice, very quiet and safe (domenica restaurant is around the corner). i didn't smell any moldy or sewage (lucky us!) they were accomodating in holding our luggage for us, coz our flight was in the evening. over all, i would book here again

Reviews.Title: “Classy - Quiet - Clean - Wonderful Bedding”
Reviews.Author: stephLa
Reviews.Content: Staff was very helpful and polite. Close enough to walk to the Superdome and other attractions. The room was very clean! The mattress and bed linens were top-quality and super-soft. Only drawback was parking around the corner in another building because our full-size SUV wouldn't fit in their garage. However, being in the middle of a city like New Orleans that is to be expected. Overall, it is a beautiful hotel and we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Would return”
Reviews.Author: Cajunbear
Reviews.Content: Checked in to the hotel, staff were very accommodating and helpful. Beds and pillows were awesome! Hotel and room were very clean and up to date. The room was quite small which I was ok with. Only thing that was a bother was the smell of the room, kind of smelt like mold. Other than that everything was wonderful. I will be returning to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, would recommend for business”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler526
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wyndham Garden Hotel for a work trip and had reserved a standard bedroom. I'm not sure if I was upgraded or if all their rooms come with a separate living room/office space, but I appreciated the extra office space since I was there for work. I also liked that they had free wireless internet. The bathroom was huge and the shower felt so amazing! The only negative about this hotel is that there was a buzzing sound that came from the vents everytime the heater was running so, I'm not sure if it was just my room or all the heaters are like that, but luckily I was able to just sleep right through it.

Reviews.Title: “Annivarsary”
Reviews.Author: sue s
Reviews.Content: We went to New Orleans for our Anni and Thanksgiving vacation. My husband had never been to New Orleans. I made all the travel arrangements and have on occasion, not selected the best of hotels. Well, I must say that I hit the jackpot this time. This Hotel is beautiful, the staff is very friendly and helpfull. It is located in the middle of everything and most things are within walking distance. We had a great time and the beds were very comfortable and a welcome after a full day of walking in the city..I would have never known that this used to be a Sears department store. Thank you Wyndham Garden and we WILL stay again next time we are in New Orleans

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: maladrin
Reviews.Content: This nifty old art deco hotel is just steps away from Canal Street in the French Quarter. Less than a 5 minute walk from Bourbon Street. Easy access to bus and trolley lines and there's also a cab stand on the corner. Friendly staff, nice rooms with comfortable beds. Free wifi for guests. There's also a decent looking sushi restaurant attached to it, but we didn't eat there. I would easily stay here again. Great bargain for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Just close enough...”
Reviews.Author: kristad314
Reviews.Content: Away from the crowds of the french quarter this was a perfect location, easily accessible to the street cars and an easy walk to Bourbon Street and the rest of the french quarter. When we checked in there was no king room available, so we ended up with a double room. The room was facing the street and a loading dock of the hotel across the street so it was very loud during the night and early morning. The beds were very comfortable and the shower was great. Two days in we asked if a king had become available and sure enough it did and we were able to switch rooms. All king rooms are located on the inside of the building so the window does not face outside, which is something I usually hate, but the room was so quiet that it was a great trade off. The king room was slightly smaller than the double room, but just as comfortable. Free Wi-Fi is a plus. There is a little cafe in the lobby that brews Starbucks coffee (but it is not actually a Starbucks), the coffee was good and they had some fruit and yogurt you can buy. However on the corner there is a Subway so you could get a cheap egg sandwich for a quick bite. The staff was friendly and helpful and they will hold your luggage for you once you check out if you have time before heading to the airport. It was a great place to stay and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: amyhallphd
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is fantastic but the exercise equipment is very dated - I had to fix the treadmill - and the room doesn't open until 0600 which is a problem if you need to be somewhere early and want to exercise before 6 AM. The staff are friendly. TV guide in the room says there are over 50 channels - I can only get the local channels to work. Furniture in room is not real comfortable and is old - but who stays in the room much when you are in New Orleans?!? The people on the room next to me had to change rooms because theirs smelled like a sewer - this was dealt with quickly and well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ladyj17
Reviews.Content: Just returned from trip for my bday over veterans day weekend. The hotel itself is decent, but the location is perfect. You can easily walk to Canal St, Bourbon St. and almost any other location you may want to see. The hotel charged a nightly occupancy tax(approx. $50 for 3 nights) that I thought was included in the room rate. The first room we were given had a very strong smell of sewage in the bathroom, thankfully we were immediately switched to a more suitable room. I opted for a room with a window facing outside as opposed to one with a hallway view, there was some outside noise but not to bad.The room was kinda small, I travelled with two other adults and we shared one room, bed was comfortable but only two fulls instead of queens. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. Would probably stay at hotel again, but would first try others in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Wyndham Garden Baronne Plaza”
Reviews.Author: Nancy L
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay here over the long Halloween weekend. The two double beds were super comfortable and we had two big windows overlooking the streets. We were also lucky enough to have a small sitting area right outside our room which made our space a lot bigger and more comfortable. The staff was wonderful and we really appreciated the friendliness of the housekeeping employees who took care of us to no end. They took pictures of us in our costumes and really gave us a great feeling about the people of New Orleans. The lobby staff were wonderful as well. Everyone was very helpful and seemed sincerely interested in making this trip the best possible. The lobby was gorgeous and had a really nice model of the city which was a cool way of getting orientated. The only complaint we had was that the windows did not open which made the room a little stuffy. Also, it was fabulous weather and we would have liked to have some fresh air in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Decent if you're not going to spend your time at the room”
Reviews.Author: seasand55
Reviews.Content: The reviews here are really accurate, but their ratings are higher than I would give this hotel. We went to NOLA to spend the night for our 3 year anniversary, and it was a last minute reservation. Due to the Voodoo Music Festival there were no bed & breakfasts available at a decent price so we had to settle for a hotel. The building's architecture is beautiful, but the way the rooms were made isn't the best. The walls are paper thin. We could hear the next door's tv. Not the most romantic of settings. The room smelled a peculiar way. The bathroom and bed were comfortable. The toiletries were nice. The customer service at the front desk left a little to be desired...let's just say the conversation upon our arrival was unprofessional at best...not what one expects from a Wyndham hotel. Overall it was ok since we were only there for the night, but I wouldn't recommend it to anyone for a long stay. The location was good because we could walk to Bourbon Street, Riverfront area, and since it's in the financial district then there was no noise from the street. The noise came from the other people in the hotel. We were awakened early by children slamming doors in our hallway. Another thing that wasn't mentioned in the hotel's website, and I didn't see in the prior reviews here, is that they charge $20 for parking. Taking that into consideration would have probably led us to pick a different hotel because as much as we spent for just one night, it just wasn't worth it. Not a good value at all!

Reviews.Title: “Better than i expected !”
Reviews.Author: ATL-LSU
Reviews.Content: one block off canal three blocks from bourbon,.. so good location for a hotel under $200. close to lot of good restaurants. Clean hotel, nice lobby, great friendly staff. rooms are lil small but had one with window and never heard street noice. would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay in New Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: mims6321
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for 3 nights in July before picking up a tour. The hotel is great, really clean, with really spacious rooms, gorgeous bathrooms and comfee beds, no noise either from the road! There was free wireless and computers in the main lobby and all the staff were really friendly. The location is fab as you are so close to canal street, and within about 3 blocks to the french quarter especially bourbon street which is the best thing about New Orleans!! The walk down to the river takes about 10 mins whilst passing lots of shops, restaurants etc. Everthing you need to see is within walking distance from this hotel. I really enjoyed New Orleans and my stay here and would recommed this hotel always!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great property”
Reviews.Author: aggiekelly92
Reviews.Content: This property is very convenient to the French Quarter and a short walk to the acquarium and riverfront. I stayed here for a conference and felt very safe walking several blocks to the conference hotel and area restaurants. The rooms are very small and face the interior of the hotel - so if you are one to require natural light, then you might not be comfortable here. The staff was very helpful and pleasant and allowed an early check-in. I'd stay at this propery again - great value for the price. It's close enough to the action of New Orleans, but not so close to hear it all.

Reviews.Title: “RETURN GUEST - AGAIN VERY PLEASED”
Reviews.Author: haze g
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property over Presidents Day weekend as we did last year. Came back because it is a great location; one block off Canal, two blocks from Bourbon street, six blocks from casino. The building is unique, the old Sears department store. Not all rooms have a street view, but a interior view. Not a problem as we were there to sleep. Rooms very comfortable and clean with good A/C. Staff was outstanding and gracious. Plan on returning again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and convenient”
Reviews.Author: RagtopRedhead
Reviews.Content: A friend and I (we're in our mid-30s) recently met up in New Orleans for a long weekend and enjoyed two nights at the Wyndham. The beds were comfortable, the room was clean, the toiletries were nice and it was very quiet. We also got some great recommendations on restaurants and coffee shops from the friendly front desk staff, and on the day we checked out they asked about our flight times and arranged a taxi for us later in the day. The location is great - just a couple minutes walk to the edge of the French Quarter, and we felt safe walking back late at night.

Reviews.Title: “MY NEW ORLEANS HOTEL...STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle W
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I just returned from staying here a few days ago and it is the only place I will be staying in New Orleans from here on out!! The rooms are great-- with some of the best beds I have stayed in and I have traveled all over (former flight attendant)! The hotel is a great value, especially since its literally two blocks from Bourbon Street/French Quarter. Its safe to walk back from Bourbon Street, esp. if you are with someone. Its right off Canal Street where there is a Walgreens on the corner, all sorts of food, street car and Harrah's Casino/ Riverwalk all the way down at the end (10 min walk). It is a beautiful property. But I have to say that the best part of our stay was the extraordinary staff. The guys at night, ROBERT & RANDY were fantastic to us! We arrived at 4am, and their welcome was amazing! They went out of their way to welcome us especially since we weren't scheduled to arrive until that afternoon...(Thanks guys!). Beautiful hotel, convenient location, great price, phenomenal guest service. Stay here, and you have nothing to fear! See you next time I'm in NOLA!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, awaesome price, convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: lovefouch
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed here for our 1st NOLA visit. The hotel is located on a busy street but has convenient parking... down side is that it's $20 per day and has VERY tight spaces! It's located 3 blocks from Bourbon St and all the action with a Walgreens right on the next corner. Our hotel room was exactly as the picture and had awesome asthetics. Very modern in style even down to the ice bucket. The beds are like coulds and they provide True Blue Spa toiletries by Bath & Body Works which are nice. Check-in and out was easy and the staff was very helpful. Other than the parking (which is standard procedure for most of the hotels in the area), the only real negative detail was the poor cell service inside the building. Overall we loved it and will definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “Worthy of 5 Star (IMO)”
Reviews.Author: darylwi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in early October 2011 for a weekend getaway. The hotel is not hard to find if you're looking for Common and Baronne. Chances are you may come down O'Keefe, there is a parking garage near there that was $15/day. If you're coming down Canal, turn down Baronne and then back up Common (first block from Canal). The hotel is about 2 blocks from the foot of Bourbon Street. Easy access to everything, easy to walk to everything. Didn't feel unsafe at all. Streetcars are about a block east (to Canal) and south (to Carondelet). The building is an old Art Deco building. It used to be a Sears but you're never tell. The interior is pretty immaculate, highly worthy of 5 star ratings. It is only 5 stories high so don't let the open atrium concern you. Some rooms do have windows that open to the atrium instead of outside. This wouldn't bother me unless I just had to have a view. And even then the view isn't that great to begin with. We had a corner room on the 5th floor looking out to the corner of Baronne and Common. Nothing much going on there but buildings. The room was pretty big, plenty of room. The bathroom was huge. They had 'complimentary' water sitting in the room but I never asked if that meant it was free so we didn't open it. There was no microwave or fridge in the room, but ice and vending was on every floor, usually a short walk. The one oddity we experienced (or at least others in my party did), was the hot water. Supposedly the water would either warm up or it would get cold during the shower. I had a hard time duplicating this but did note that once the water did start to cool off during the shower, but I just turned the knob further and it warmed up again. I had plenty of hot water. The beds are super soft and sink in. Some people love this and others hate it. I found them very comfortable. Same deal with the pillows. Very comfortable. For breakfast, there is an IHOP across Canal Street. But let me suggest the Streetcar Cafe also. It's a block down on Carondelet and they have always been great. It was a little slower this time because we ordered some grits and they were a little slow in making them (had to cook more), so the service was a little slower than before, but the food was still great. I'd eat there again, and again. We did not eat in the sushi bar at the hotel or try any of the other amenities. I found the staff to be very friendly though and generally always smiling. We had a room with two double beds. The beds do feel like they sit a little high but still comfortable. There is parking but when I got there I couldn't figure out how to use their garage anyway, so I ended up next door, cheaper. Be warned, take your ticket or you may get locked out of the garage after hours. But of course you could just walk up the in ramp like I did, walk to the 2nd floor and then get in the elevator there to continue up. All in all, a very fine NOLA stay. I'd recommend it certainly, unless you really want to be right in the action in the Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: JanbukD
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time in New Orleans! The staff at the Wyndham Garden Barrone gave us tips on where to go and where to eat. John, Claressa and Ronald were so helpful. Without the friendly, helpful staff, we may not have had such a great time! The hotel lobby and rooms were clean. The location was a few blocks from the French Quarter,so we got a great low price as we were not in the French Quarter!

Reviews.Title: “A lot of luxury for a little money!!”
Reviews.Author: Mildred5404
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel. Helpful staff. A block from the French Quarter, Awesome bedding, Best of all----- A GREAT RATE. We traveled on Amtrak from Birmingham to New Orleans. I booked through Amtrak.

Reviews.Title: “good enough...but definately not great”
Reviews.Author: hotelreview12350226
Reviews.Content: 1) this hotel DOES NOT have king bed rooms with and exterior view. all king rooms have windows that face into the lobby. Makes for a very dark room. 2) the first room we got was a king bed for me and my boyfriend. the room smelled like cigarettes, even though we were told the room was non smoking. The man at the front desk was happy to move us but we had to move to a room with two doubles! that is not convenient for a couple. 3) i have a random $25 charge on my credit card for no reason. 4) i called to get my room cleaned and no one ever came. When i called the front desk they said it showed my room was cleaned but it never was overall this hotel is mediocre. nothing too special but it was clean and had a good location and price. I wouldn't stay here again unless the price was significantly lower than other options.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL hotel and WONDERFUL staff! We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: psychchick74
Reviews.Content: My husband and some friends of ours went to New Orleans for a weekend get-a-way. When we walked into the lobby of the Wyndham Garden Hotel, we were in awe. The hotel is absolutely beautiful.. From check-in to check-out, the staff was friendly and very helpful. The rooms were nice and clean and the beds were comfortable. The location is very convenient to shopping, eating and, of course, Bourbon Street. I will most certainly be back. Thank you for making a very positive lasting impression on our first (and not last) trip to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “a little bit of luxury for less”
Reviews.Author: lily_2486
Reviews.Content: I booked through Travelocity and was able to get the Wyndham Garden Hotel Baronne Plaza for a good price. We were looking for something mid price and good location, this hotel was perfect. Only blocks from French Quarter everything was within walking distance. We were lucky that we got a room on the 5 floor with an exterior window so the room was bright and quiet. The hotel use to be a shopping plaza so half of the rooms have windows that face the open foyer area inside. The beds were big and very comfortable with good section of pillows. All of the staff were very friendly and happy to store our bags on the last day and call a taxi for us to go to the airport. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Was Awesome!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MsIndependent433
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at this hotel the hospitality and service was great. The first time was with a group of women for a girls weekend and the second visit in August was with a group of couples. The location for both occasions was really awesome. I would definately stay here over and over again.

Reviews.Title: “good incidental charges expensive”
Reviews.Author: dsully1021
Reviews.Content: The staff is what made this hotel work. The hotel does need some updating and fixing. It was clean and neat, the price was really good. It was quiet. My only complaint is incidental charges. I had to valet park due to no self parking left. I was charged $30 per night even though I did not use my car while I stayed there. I could understand being charged once or if I took the car out. I just though $60 for parking for two night was expensive. They did not notify me per night. I thought it was one time if I did not move my car. I did know the charge for microwave and refrig was $10 a night. I just wish it was included with the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: dominique c
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel was extremely nice!! All the night crew helped us!! We had many questions and they were always willing to help!! The room was extremely clean! we have stayed in many hotels in this area and by far this was the nicest.. was also nice that you could hook up games, dvd player to the tv... very nice for kids.. we will definatly staying here for future trips

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gmc82661
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a family trip to New Orleans. Stayed at the Wyndham Baronne Plaza July 29 through August 5th. The hotel is conveniently located about two blocks from the french quarter. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Half of the rooms in the hotel do not have an exterior view. They have windows that look out into the interior corridors. If this is a problem for you, I would recommend that you call the hotel prior you your stay and request a room with an exterior view. Rooms are of an average size but well appointed. Our room had two double beds with a chair and ottoman. Also had a desk & desk chair. The beds were comfortable with luxurious linens. The room had a wall mounted flat panel TV with a good selection of channels. The bathroom was clean with updated vanity with a granite top and granite tile tub surround and floor. One thing "quirky" about the shower is that when taking a shower, the water would stop flowing for a couple of seconds mid way through and restarts. Kind of weird but not a problem. Actually got a chuckle out of it. Hotel has free wireless internet that we took advantage of. Had no issues with download speeds or connecting. Hotel has onsite underground parking for a $20 daily fee. Would have been nice if this was included in the room rate. The hotel does not offer complementary breakfast in the morning. Something I think that they should consider. There is a place in the lobby where you can purchase quick breakfast items though (coffee,bagels, danish, cereal etc...) We stopped there one morning for a quick bite and it met our needs. There also is Japanese Sushi restaurant off the lobby. We did not eat there so I won't comment. Overall our stay was enjoyable and would consider staying again if we were to visit New Orleans in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Pinkness3
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly right off the bat. As I was puuting money in the parking meter, one of the valets caught my attention to inform me that I did not have to pay for parking after 6pm, then he showed me where I could move my car for cheap parking in th morning. The concierge was very knowledgeable about the pricing to expect at each restaurant that he suggested. Towels were big and fluffy and the beds were super comfortable. Great location for a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: gubosson
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was nice. Nothing spectacular. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. The negatives were the garage to park in was horrible and tiny and they charge you $20.00 to park there. There is only one entrance/exit so if you are trying to get out you can't if someone is coming in. This hotel also does not serve breakfast. It was the only one on our trip that did not. Check in was at 3:00pm but we had to wait until 4:15pm for our room to be ready. Did get a 10% discount on that but ONLY after we ask about it. The hotel was not offering it up and the lady at the desk complained that it was the other customers fault for checking out late what was she supposed to do about it.

Reviews.Title: “stayed there in april liked it great location”
Reviews.Author: captsin
Reviews.Content: just stayed one night on our way back from destin florida. freindly staff nice clean room ,great location great price much cheaper than our stay in april. found great new resteraunt the red gravey close by.must have peach preserves on bisquit awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Improvment”
Reviews.Author: dugbrown
Reviews.Content: A reasonably comfortable hotel, our room had an overwhelmingly strong odor of Lysol like a smoker had previously been there or some other issue. The room was not very clean, vents and ducts needed special attention with caked on layers of dirt.

Reviews.Title: “The staff is the reason to stay here”
Reviews.Author: jalaw
Reviews.Content: From the front desk, to the bellhops, to the maid staff, these people are the reason to stay here. Friendly, helpful, and easy to deal with. Helpful with suggestions, info for the area (including places to stay out of.) Maid staff fully accommodating - Note: Down filled pillows and blanket/comforter - they have synthetic available on request, for those with allergies. In addition, they to spray air lifter or freshener. Again, they will discontinue the spray for those allergic. Rooms are small. Furniture is the most useless I have seen in a hotel. Furniture is short (under 3 feet) and the bed is over tall (over 3 feet.) 2 feet separated the beds. The closet is short, and will not allow for dresses or coats to hang. The beds, like I said, are over tall, and over soft. Plenty of pillows. The bathroom is also small. High step into the tub/shower. Water pressure was, well, strange. Both times I took a shower the water completely cut off - for a full second- then came back on. Strange. WARNING: It is VERY easy to BURN YOURSELF with the water. Double check the temperature AFTER you swap from tub spout to shower. Remember: The majority of the rooms do not have outside windows. Not a big deal. During the hotter months, try to get a room on the lower floors. The heat collects in the 5th floor hallways. The restaurant is not one. It is a place where you can get pre-prepared sandwiches and drinks. There is a Sushi restaurant connected directly to the hotel lobby. Do not recommend the Sushi restaurant. Location, location, location. This place has it. One block off of Canal Street. One block south of Bourbon Street. Easy walking distance to the tourist section of Bourbon Street. Most hotels charge far more to park your car. Here it is $20 or 1/3 to 1/2 less than other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Stay...still one block from Canal Street”
Reviews.Author: JaeATL
Reviews.Content: Stay here during the Essence Festival. Clean and walking distances to everything. Staff was friendly. Would def stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: lmarshall
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel with great staff. We had a few problems. Our first room was smelly so they moved us. That room wasn't ready so they moved us again. Other than moving the beds were comfy and overall the hotel was clean and nice. Location was great too!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy but it wasnt bad”
Reviews.Author: darightman4u
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a GREAT location right in the business district. Its only a 5 minute walk or a couple of blocks from Bourbon street. There's a 24hr IHOP 1 block up on Canal St. as well. My problem is that the hotel did not have room service for one. The front desk was nice enough to give me some menus for nearby restaurants that delivered to your door. They even gave me a call once the delivery person arrived to let me know they were on their way up. Excellent and friendly staff! The workout room was good enough to get a full body work out. A couple of tread mills, elliptical and weights. There was no pool which was a major disappointment to me but if I would have read the amenities thoroughly I would have known. The self parking was $20 per day and the valet was $30 a day! if you are staying longer than a day or two you might want to look into parking around the corner. All in all my stay was fine but not great! The hotel is conveniently located with a old style and welcoming decor' . The staff was super friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The lack of room service, the lack of pool and the high parking is the only reason I didnt rate this place a 4 or 5.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel at a Low Price”
Reviews.Author: jfoote
Reviews.Content: The room was purchased for friends who were meeting us in New Orleans. The hotel seems to be a new conversion of an existing office building and features a large, impressive lobby and quality rooms. The French Quarter and Bourbon Street are about two blocks away. The negatives would be parking for over $20 a night and no breakfast. The Wyndham should be considered highly when visiting New Orleans, especially if the price remains low.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bdinnab
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay. No complaints. Outstanding staff very accommodating. Great location. We rented a van but returned it the next day because things are within walking distance or street cars are available. All day passes are $3.00 and travel to several major attractions. If you do drive, park on the street to avoid parking charges. Wonderful comfy bed, nice clean rooms. Quiet. We will definitely be back if in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: Lees33
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week and received 4 star treatment. The staff was wonderful including Terri and Denise at the desk and James in maintenance. Everyone who worked there greeted you with a smile. The room was very nice and the location couldn't be better. We have stayed at 4 star hotels and the staff here was better than many of those.

Reviews.Title: “Well Appointed up market rooms in great location”
Reviews.Author: J_Samsa
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great, only about 200 yards from Bourbon Street, however in a quiet side street so you don't get the traffic or crowd noises. The room was very clean with a huge king bed and the high speed wifi worked well. All the furniture in our room appeared to be new and hotel staff were very friendly. Will definitely stay here again. Parking costs some money, but it's the same with all of the hotels in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Locationâ€”Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: Huggabeans
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located about 2 blocks away from Canalâ€”3 blocks from Burbanâ€”and only 1 block away from the street cars. Everything is within walking distance. No need to get a rental car!!! We were happy to be a few blocks away from Burbanâ€”because we wanted sleep! It was nice to leave the loud music â€“to a quiet hotel. The rooms were adequateâ€”but did not come with refrigerators or microwaves. There are no windows facing the exterior of the buildingsâ€¦but there really isnâ€™t anything to see. The rooms cost about $100 a nightâ€”the best deal we could find in the area. There wasnâ€™t any breakfastâ€”but there is a Starbucks in the lobbyâ€”with pastries. Thereâ€™s also TONS of places in the French quarter to eat!! Soâ€”thereâ€™s no need to stay in your hotel. There is a Sushi Restaurant downstairsâ€”but didnâ€™t look to inviting. Overallâ€”great stay! fyi--if you are driving--the hotel charges about $30 a night. There's cheaper parking--at a garage nearby.

Reviews.Title: “great location, helful staff”
Reviews.Author: BobinSTL
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nice sized, comfortable, clean and attractive. The front desk staff are extremely accommodating, friendly and helpful. They provided useful tips about restaurants, gave us discount coupons for one, helped us understand the trolley routes and directions to destinations we were seeking. The hotel is near the French Quarter (two blocks) but far enough away from Bourbon street to avoid the noise and smell. Ideal location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay...we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: hlp14312
Reviews.Content: From the time we walked in the door until the time we left, we had exceptional service. We had ridden Amtrak for 13 hours when we finally arrived, missing our stroller for our 3 year old. Amtrak had apparently left it in Atl. John at the front desk had one and let us borrow it for the weekend. He also upgraded our room since we had been having trouble that day. And what a fantastic room! The beds slept great...I want one at home! Very quiet, great view, big bath tub, fridge, and internet! Felt like home.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel and staff!”
Reviews.Author: DaniKJ
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent experience staying at this hotel. My room was comfortable/clean and the staff was always helpful. The hotel is in a great location in relation to local attractions. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in historic building”
Reviews.Author: xcapee
Reviews.Content: I am glad I picked this hotel as it is very conveniently located just off Canal street and 2 blocks from Bourbon St. Being away from the French Quarter means you get some peace and quiet as well away from the drunken antics. I was surprised by the size of the hotel with it's large interior walkways and courtyards. The lobby is impressive and looks like it belongs to a more expensive hotel. My room was spacious and seems to be the normal size for a Wyndham King room. Plenty of floor space and a full sized desk make it very practical. The complimentary wireless internet worked well and the 2 bottles of complimentary water is a nice touch especially in such a hot and humid area. The surrounding area seems pretty safe even late at night as it is pretty well lit and there is plenty of foot traffic. Service from the front desk was very friendly and ever helpful and they efficiently organised me a taxi to the airport on check out. There is an attached Japanese restaurant but I didn't try it so can't comment although it looked pretty empty on both Sat and Sunday nights. Additionally there is pseudo Star Bucks cafe at the lobby which is handy in the morning if you don't want to walk far from the hotel to get coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Great service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: betterthan1st
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived, my wife and I were very impressed with design of the lobby and its location. It was convenient to park ( although we had to pay for parking, in New Orleans, I challenge you to find a hotel that doesn't) The person that was working the front desk ( his name was John) was especially friendly, providing everything we needed and giving excellent information about local interests. The rooms were comfortable, but it was the staff that made this trip the best I had in a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional staff, very comfortable hotel. Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: ashlynr
Reviews.Content: The front desk was extremely helpful, especially the manager John, with taxi bookings to the airport and general info. Rooms were very well kept, and sleep was restful. It was a short walk from the quarter, and it was safe at all hours. Enjoyed my stay, would book there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: dachsiemomTulsa
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and bed is fantastic. Room had no outside window. We were pleased with the accomodations and felt the location was very close to french quarter. Very good price for the accomodation. The only bad thing we have to say is our room was right next to service elevator and we had to deal with lots of noise of housekeepers and carts on this elevator!! Other than that we were pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Front Desk, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: BOSbob
Reviews.Content: Special Thanks to John on the front desk for helping me make a deadline by allowing me to print up a file on his printer. It was a busy late Thursday night and he graciously offered his assistance. In addition, the location is walking distance to everything. A short two block walk to Bourbon Street, this hotel is situated in a quiet safe area. The front desk staff always had a friendly hello when I passed thru Thier lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: eubie_05
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the Jazz and Heritage Festival. Easy one block walk to Canal street and the street cars; cross Canal and the French Quarter begins. Rooms are quiet and clean, with comfortable beds. Rooms have windows looking out on hotel interior and internal atrium. Desk staff was very friendly and helpful-got us festival shuttle service and had a taxi waiting for us at check out. I was pleasantly surprised and pleased at both the quality and value of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jeffHalifax
Reviews.Content: Great price, great location, comfortable room...what more do you want? I stayed here for 4 days in April 2011. The central location made exploring New Orelans very easy. The room was quiet and well appointed and the king bed was very comfortable. They have good discounts if you book multiple nights. Desk staff were very friendly and helpful. My only complaint was not being able to print anything but boarding passes in the business center. High speed internet was free and reliable. I'll stay there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: travelingcircuit
