Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the stay. Friendly staff, comfortable rooms, especially the bed. Very clean, would absolutely recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: cherylthpearl
Reviews.Content: This was the first stop on our 8 day roadtrip and after reading the reviews, I chose this hotel. My sister, mother, and I were pleasantly surprised by the impeccable service. The hotel is located within walking distance of the French Quarters, eateries, street car lines, etc. It is not "in" the Quarters, but it is only a few blocks away. I enjoyed the fitness center and the "reading" areas. The only negatives that I have are (1) This property does not have a swimming pool. (2) Parking is $20 for self-parking, which is in the basement with only one lane for both incoming and outgoing traffic...$30 for valet parking. (3) Only a Sushi restaurant on the premises. (4) The first 2 days of our stay when we returned to our room, we realized that the cleaning person had not cleaned the bathroom and we would have to call the front desk...usually after the cleaning crew had left for the day; however, the maintenance man would come immediately and do a wonderful job of cleaning. We found out later that the regular housekeeper was on vacation and they were using a temporary housekeeper. All in all, we had a very pleasant stay and the front desk employees were very helpful and kind. Would I stay again? Absolutely...in a heartbeat!!!

Reviews.Title: “staffing issues?”
Reviews.Author: findjul
Reviews.Content: Pros: This hotel is well located, a short walk across Canal from the FQ. The room/bathroom was well appointed with good towels and bedding, Had a nice tv and a safe for valuables. Starbucks coffee in lobby. Cons: Hot water was an issue at times and the honesty of the maid service came into question. Window, no balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Close to French Quarter but quieter than staying on Bourbon St.”
Reviews.Author: roandoak
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, with super comfortable beds which is rare in hotels in this price range. It's a block away from the French Quarter which makes it easily walkable but much quieter than hotels on Bourbon St. The lobby and rooms are nice and the Front Desk staff was friendly and helpful. The window in my room overlooked the lobby area so I had to keep the drapes closed all the time. Next time I would request a room with a street view. I asked Housekeeping to leave the heavy comforter off the bed during my stay (weather was hot and humid) and they made it up every day with the comforter. Also, they didn't leave fresh towels a couple of times when I left the dirty ones on the floor. I'd reccomend this hotel as a nice place in a good location. There is a cute little breakfast area in the lobby and it would have been a great place to have breakfast included in the price of the hotel. They don't offer that and I didn't find any breakfast places close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: amarques99
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a perfect LOCATION. 1 minute walk from the airport bus stop, 1 minute walk to the Canal Street with its millions shopping options, 1 minute walk to the Garden District Street Car, 2 minute walk to Bourbon Street, ACME and FELIX Oyster Bar. 10 minute TOP to Jackson Square and French Market. My ROOM was very spacious, with a incredible king size bed, LCD tv with lots of channels, AC working fine, good linens on the bed. The BATHROOM had good amenities and a very good shower too. The towels were always clean and smelled good. The in-room safe has a good space, can fit a 15 inch notebook. There are vending/ice machines on each floor and I have no problem whatsoever with noise. There is a coffee shop with Starbucks brewed coffee at the lobby. The STAFF was helpful and always in good mood, remembering me and my previous requests. Last but not least, FREE WIFI @ rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel .... Terrible Housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: DukeyTheDog
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. The front desk staff is great! Very accommodating and knowledgable. Unfortunately, the house keeping staff could be better .... MUCH BETTER. They barely cleaned our room over our week long stay. The best they did was give us fresh towels daily. They woulsnmake the bed but that's it! They never cleaned the bathroom, or emptied the garbage. If I was the management here I would fire the person in charge of house keeping. It is simply unacceptable!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly, Comfortable & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Schwally
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend stay, April 15-17. The reviews are so true - this place cannot be beat!!!! The lobby is spacious & welcoming, with conveniences like a coffee shop, minature model of the French Quarter, and plenty of seating nooks. The architecture is very interesting to look at as well. Check-in was a breeze; front desk was friendly & quick. Terri was especially helpful in providing info on how to navigate the Garden District & very personable. Loved her!!!!!! Upon entering the room, it even smelled clean!!! The beds were inviting with multiple comforters, blankets, sets of sheets, and pillows galore! The mattresses even have a memory foam top. Overall look was contemporary with dark furniture and flat screen tv. There's a convenient bench, shelf, desk & tables for holding all of your travel items. The bathroom is nicely appointed with a generous tub/shower combo, granite tile & plenty of towels. Although the hotel was full on Saturday night, we didn't hear a thing & got great rest! The location is one block off of Canal street, so although the Quarter is close, you're still far enough removed to have the quiet. As two young women who keep tabs on our surroundings, we felt very safe in the area. Barrone/Dauphine is a busy enough street to feel safe, even at night. Overall a great stay --> we both said we'd love to stay at this hotel again & said 'I love our hotel' numerous times during our visit. Thanks, Wyndham! Great Job!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Walklady
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for 3 nights --couldn't ask for a better location and accomodations! We parked the car in the hotel garage, and just left it there! Walked all over the city, took the street cars, and had the best time! This hotel is in the French Quarter, and within walking distance to just about everything! The restaurant/sushi bar located right there in the hotel is wonderful. Excellent food for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, immaculate room, most friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: jackson177
Reviews.Content: The staff was wonderfully friendly and helpful. We stayed a total of 10 nights. Best hotel bed we can remember ever having. The french quarter is only a block away, trolly line is also one block away. Great restaurants close by and aways felt safe walking all around the area. The only thing I could wish for is to have a Windham Garden Baronne Plaza in every city to which we travel!!!! Thank You!!

Reviews.Title: “lucky to find it ...”
Reviews.Author: Arkale
Reviews.Content: I moved from another (disappointing) hotel where I stayed for two nights. The staff of Baronne Plaza was welcoming and helpful. The "atmosphere" is simple but elegant - especially the lobby. The room was nice too. The room and the nice bathroom were very clean and tidy, also the main public area. Very important for me since it was business trip - the hotel is very queit. I stayed for another day to visit New Orleans and found the location perfect - reasonable walking distance from every main attraction.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, couple of housekeeping dings”
Reviews.Author: ElleLaJolla
Reviews.Content: Our trip was for business and leisure, and the hotel was in the right location for both. The Wyndham Garden Hotel is a five minute walk from Bourbon Street in the French Quarter, but does not have the party noise of that area. It is also within walking distance of the Convention Center and other hotels where my husband attended conferences. The front desk staff is very friendly and helpful. They were very knowledgeable and answered our many questions with lots of patience. I can't say as much for the housekeeping staff who must have had a bad day (or week). Let's just say they did not display the friendliness that I associate with New Orleans. The hotel lobby is very clean and inviting. It has different seating areas so people can visit and have meetings or simply watch the basketball game. I loved the display of the city in miniature. We got upgraded to a suite which was an inside room, with a window facing toward the landing which looks down into the lobby. We kept the curtains closed because of people walking by to their rooms. Even with the curtains open, the room is very dark and lights are required all the time. The room was very quiet, and even the sound of people walking by was muted. The king size bed was very comfortable with nice linens. It was easy to oversleep (as we did) in that dark and quiet room. The room had two flat screen TVs, one for the bed and the other for the little sitting area. Now for the dings: The whir of small refrigerator was a bit distracting at times. The carpeting looked dated and had a couple of stains. The large bathroom had an odd shower stall design with a tile step up into the shower. This could be a hazard for elderly people and impossible to get into for disabled people. The bathtub was large, but the long black hair on the bottom of the tub was a definite turn-off. The tile floor in the bathroom looked like it needed a good scrubbing. I did not want to walk on that floor on my bare feet. The first two days the tissue box was empty, until I placed the container on top of the toilet so housekeeping could not miss it. It was replenished. There was no bath mat, and I had to use one of the towels to prevent slipping on a wet floor. Only on the second to the last day of our stay were plastic drinking cups placed by the ice bucket. The ice bucket was never checked for melted ice. These were all minor issues, but put together they forced me to deduct some points because it showed a carelessness that should not happen in a nice hotel. If I were management of Wyndham, I would hire a quality control person for housekeeping, a "white glove" person who would do a quick check after a housekeeper is finished with a room. This would reveal the flaws I mentioned, which could then be easily remedied. I understand that this is the high season for tourists, but I would have expected a little more attention to detail for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Excellence at it's finest and the knowledgable, friendly Staff to support it!!”
Reviews.Author: TheMissouriFolks
Reviews.Content: My husband, father-in-law and myself stayed at the Wyndham Baronne Plaza for Mardi Gra 2011 and we can't say enough good things about the hotel and it's staff! From the time of arrival, we were greeted by friendly staff outside helping us getting checked in and advising us where to park. The staff at the front desk were as warm and welcoming, giving us information about the hotel, local dining, Mardi Gra information and letting us know they were there for us if we needed ANYTHING. The room was VERY CLEAN, how refreshing not to wonder about the linens, etc. !!! An extremely comfortable bed, beautiful white linens, comfortable furniture as well as a desk in the room. Convenient ice, drink & snack machines also. The housekeeping staff did an excellent job, they were very friendly and considerate of guests and their requests. The hotel is conveniently located to the French Quarter, 1 block off Canal St. and just minutes from Bourbon Street. We enjoyed a variety of great food by recommendation of the hotel staff, also within minutes of the hotel. Many thanks to all the staff at the hotel as we had an awesome time!! From the morning hours heading out to the early hours of the morning we returned to the hotel, we were greeted by your smiling faces and great conversation. I would highly recommend your hotel to anyone traveling to New Orleans and look forward to seeing you again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Location”
Reviews.Author: SusanH1962
Reviews.Content: John at the front desk is fantastic. This is a smallhotel situated in a fantastic location it is clean and vey quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: ProudCanadian53
Reviews.Content: Staff members Terri, John, Matthew, John were excellent with their suggestions! The only downside is that there is not a full-service American restaurant onsite and no coin laundry. There is the Sunshine Cafe for breakfast items and the Yokohama Sushi Restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “One star: staff stole things from our room”
Reviews.Author: this_aaron
Reviews.Content: We left to eat breakfast, then came back to checkout about an hour before the checkout time. Our room had been "stripped" of our remaining belongings. Luckily we had already packed most of our stuff in the car, so it probably wasn't more than $50 worth. The staff did not seem very apologetic, they had assumed that we would not be returning to the room, though we had not indicated this in any way. They did find and return some of the items. Otherwise: The hotel is in a good location, just a short walk to the French District. The beds were comfortable. The bathroom looked nice, but the water had a bad odor. The a/c vents were very dusty, and in poor shape. I didn't notice much noise. I wish there had been a pool.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: SheriC30
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited New Orleans for Mardi Gras 2011and stayed at Wyndham Garden Hotel. Our stay was made more comfortable with the knowledge of locations by your staff. We especially enjoyed John Cabeza (front desk). I looked forward to seeing him each day and always was received with a friendly welcome and smile. Everyone we encountered that work at Wyndham was especially nice from the ladies that worked in the coffee shop to the gentlemen that checked ID's at the door to the maintenance people. I would not hesitate to recommend Wyndham Garden to any of our friends or family.

Reviews.Title: “Wyndham Baronne Plaza Hotel staff saved our vacation.”
Reviews.Author: cturner217
Reviews.Content: We had first booked a reservation at another hotel chain through Book.it.com. However, the first hotel recommended by them was a disaster. We then walked from the first hotel to the Wyndham to find suitable lodging. We can not say enough about how wonderful the entire staff was at the Wyndham, especially John Cabeza who held us a room until we could check out from the other hotel and made certain the accommodations at the new hotel was superb. In addition, the hotel general manager, Matthew Thomas, and Terry Ford were also very helpful to make our transition complete because bookit was no assistance to us at all. The lodging at Wyndham was superior. We had a five-star room with five-star service in ever way. When we go back to New Orleans, I will make it a point to stay with them again. And, this time, we will go direct to the hotel itself and by-pass bookit.com completely.

Reviews.Title: “Restful Stay in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: majorr
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a two night stay at the Wyndham Garden. We wanted to stay near the French Quarter and spend a lot of time there, but we didn't want to stay in the French Quarter. The Wyndham Garden is just one block away from Canal St. and a five minute walk from Bourbon St. We had a very large room with a king bed. It was very clean and well maintained. We experienced a small plumbing problem, which was repaired quickly and caused us no inconvience. The room was very quiet and restful, after the craziness of the French Quarter. The room was a great value for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: vbayne
Reviews.Content: Our room on the 3rd floor was quiet and very comfortable. The mattress and bed covers were top quality and we slept great! All the staff members were very helpful! The location was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Time Had by All!”
Reviews.Author: gooofygal25
Reviews.Content: My gf and I travelled to NOLA for the very 1st time for her bday and stayed @ the Wyndham Garden Baronne, and it was a wonderful experience! The front desk was extremely polite and very helpful to both myself and my gf. They spoke everytime they saw us, whether we were going or coming back! Our 1st night we needed a cab and the Gentleman @ the front desk called and called again when they didn't arrive in a timely manner, we really appreciated that! We also had a tour booked and had too print our tickets and the Lady @ the front desk went out of her way to assist my gf with getting it printed b/c the printer was having issues @ the time, and that was truly wonderful! We are hopefully having a destination committment ceromony in the future and we will definately want our guests too stay at this Hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “excellant service at the front desk”
Reviews.Author: jjbGastoniaNc
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the nice beds and spacious rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the CBD of New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Rexifybab59
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a former Sears building in New Orleans. Close to the Quarter, Tulane Hospital (where I was teaching). Super service. Quiet, very comfortable rooms. Close to good places to eat, and easy access to many of New Orleans' great attractions. Walking distance to many things including the St. Charles and Canal St. Street car lines. Clean rooms and good housekeeping. Front desk folks really helpful. Business center small but very workable. The area has some ongoing construction and repair after Katrina. This hotel is in the Central Business District. I was not afraid to be out at night, but I was careful.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD RATES BUT LOTS OF NOISE...”
Reviews.Author: PuddinpieNWFlorida
Reviews.Content: Rooms were rather small but adequate, though the common areas on each floor were very spacious. Thought we were getting queen beds but they were double. Our room was cleaned once in 5 days. Housekeeping was off on Christmas Day but somehow we got overlooked the other 4 days for whatever reason. We were able to get clean towels upon request. Towels seemed very thin. We stayed on the 4th floor facing Common Street and extremely loud noises woke us up every morning at 5-6am. NOT what you want to happen in New Orleans after staying up late every night. Perhaps other areas of the hotel were better sound proofed. Fitness room, lobby, & computer area were nice and clean. Front desk people were friendly and helpful. There was a small coffee shop in the lobby which was handy. There was a PJ's a couple blocks down the street which had much better prices and variety. Our coffee machine had a mildew/musty smell so we did not use that. There was a Sushi restaurant attached but no one was in there at all, then entire 5 days we were there. No room service.

Reviews.Title: “7 Minute walk to Bourbon and Canal”
Reviews.Author: Sigirl33
Reviews.Content: I loved the location of this hotel. We contiplated booking a hotel on bourbon and we were thankful we didn't. It's loud, dirty and sometimes unfriendly at night. We were glad to walk 4 blocks down to our quiet and peaceful hotel. They serviced the room daily and did an excellent job. The staff said good morning to us every morning and the front desk even advised us on things to do and see. I would highly recommend this hotel. Also, if you wanted to book online tours there, the business center is open and right next to the elevators. Free wifi and Starbucks down stairs! Make sure you ask for a room that looks out to the street. Some open to the enterior of the hotel since it used to be an old Sears building.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, fair prices & good location.”
Reviews.Author: DJF5000
Reviews.Content: A large group of us stayed at this hotel over New Years. It is just outside the French District (maybe a 3 minute walk). The hotel was pretty quiet considering we stayed over New Years! Though the walls seemed thin at times we had no real issues sleeping and no one complained about our group either (and we may have been loud a few times...). The beds were comfortable enough, the room was clean and modern (nice flat screen) though not huge. The staff at the front desk was very nice & helpful. There is no free breakfast or coffee but they have a little coffee shop and there are SO many food choices in walking distance. The only real negative is that many rooms have no outside window... the only window faces inside which is odd. But for the price it's a nice room and really other than sleeping... we didn't spend much time in the hotel anyway. Oh and parking is $30 a night at the hotel. I didn't have a car but my brother did and he found parking down the street for $5/night. Guess you just need to drive around a bit to find a better deal. Overall, this is a good value hotel near the French Quarter. I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Hotel Close to French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: michiganchris
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Baronne Plaza in early November for a long weekend getaway. This hotel's location is very good - only a couple blocks (5-10 minutes) from the French Quarter. It is also convenient to the St. Charles streetcar line for easy access to the Garden District. During our stay the hotel was fairly quiet. There was a group of young women playing games in the hallway outside our room one of the nights after midnight. They politely moved after we told them they were keeping us up. The room was clean. The bed was very comfy and was quite welcoming after long days of walking around. Our only wish was that the room overlooked the street instead of the hotel's atrium. We kept our drapes drawn at all times as people could look right in otherwise. We did use the fitness center which was small but adequate. I don't believe there was a pool. The staff was friendly and professional. Check in/check out was smooth and quick. There is a sushi restaurant and a small coffee shop on site as well. We didn't eat at either so can't really comment on them. All in all a nice stay in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Try another location”
Reviews.Author: travelgal1022
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel cause it was not in the French Quarter but located relatively close. It's listed as a three star but I would say it's more like a two star and in need of updating. The rooms are old with brown patterned carpet that looks dingy overall with lots of stains. The furniture is scarred and there are stains on the walls, trash cans and furniture. (This description is for the first and second room I stayed.) The folks were nice but not really responsive. The toilet in the first room would run for several minutes to an hour after flushing. The tank contained a super flush system so there was nothing I could do on my own, ie could not put the flap down or anything. I called a few times to complain and finally on the fourth day of the visit, they sent someone one up to take a look even though a note was left the night before stating I wanted someone to take a look the next day. Of course the toilet stopped running by the time the manager arrived and when he flushed it a few times, it would stop relatively quickly. He asked me if I wanted to change rooms to which I said no because I did not want to be inconvenienced by having to move everything. The last time he flushed it he waited a few minutes then said well it seems to be working and left. The toilet continued to run after he left so I waited 10 mins then called down to tell them the toilet was still running. The manager arrived, went into the bath and within a minute of his arrival, the toilet stopped. So this time it ran for approximately 15 mins before stopping. The manager said, well it seemed to have stopped, let me time it. I stated, you flushed before left, how long were you gone. He said, 7-8 mins, I said more but either way, now it's just stopping. No matter how long it takes to stop, the point is that it's taking longer than it should so timing it is not an adequate troubleshooting method. Someone needs to look inside the mechanism. Long story short, the manager had no idea of what he was doing so I said, yeah, go ahead and move me. So I moved to a room that smells like wet, musty socks. Thank God I'm leaving tomorrow morning, early. There are more than enough higher quality hotels that are in the area. I strongly suggest staying in of those.

Reviews.Title: “What a great, convenient hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TravelinGalUSA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wyndham Garden at Baronne Plaza, got a suite on the fifth floor for under $100/night. What a great little hotel. It isn't the biggest hotel, but it is so convenient to everything. We flew in and took a taxi to the hotel, and we were able to walk everywhere. It was super clean, the staff was so nice and accommodating. It was a little loud after the Saints game on Sunday, but it wasn't unbearable. Perfect little hotel if you are looking to go to New Orleans and have a nice place to stay without spending a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Great beds, great location”
Reviews.Author: CypressPatterson
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for the convienence of walking to the Superdome and we thought the price was right. The beds and bedding were wonderful. We were issued a handicapped room (but we had not asked for that, we just got it), and the room was huge. The bathroom was cavernous. It had a giant roll in shower with a fantastic showerhead. We had no problems with water pressure. The shampoo, lotion, etc was from Bath and Body Works and I liked that. The floor was pretty granite or marble or something like that - it was beautiful but talk about cold! Ha. There was a blow dryer, iron, safe, writing desk, lamp, desk chair , comfy chair with ottoman in the room. The whole hotel was art deco and pretty cool visually. There was a sitting room off the lobby with a fake fireplace, interesting furniture, and a tv. Lots of couches and chairs were in the big lobby for meeting people. A Starbucks and a sushi bar restaurant were attached to the hotel and that was convenient. Parking was self parking the the basement. We fit, but there were very few spaces and it was a tight fit. Not for the timid driver. Fortunately, there is ample self-parking garages very close and our friends with big vehicles had to park there. It was ok. But it is NOT valet parking. Our room was on the 2nd floor directly above the basement garage entrance/exit and faced Common Street, therefore it was a bit noisy. We had a view of the parking garage across the street. But our friends on the 4th floor heard nothing. If we stay here again we will request a room NOT facing Common Street. Rooms facing the inside of the building were quiet. We were not there for the view so that was not an issue for us. The service was fast and friendly and they also directed us to more close late night dining options we did not know about.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: terribluefire
Reviews.Content: We travel to New Orleans for pleasure, from time to time, and find this hotel to be one of the better we have stayed in. Reasonable prices in a great location for making our way onto Canal St and the French Quarter, without being in the FQ. The onsite parking is horrible in way of getting a spot and very cramped quarters - mostly appropriate for small to mid-sized cars only. I don't know how anyone handicapped could utilize this parking, as the only access to the hotel is by stairs, from the parking. Friends who met us there were told they had to park around the corner at another parking facility - they drove a truck. People who complain about paying to park must live in a bubble -- and need to get over it. That is not a big deal in my world. The rooms are nice and provide all the basic amenities. The bed was amazingly comfortable. Bathroom quite small, and we did not have the water pressure issue as described in other posts. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful. It was quiet and clean. Only real complaint for me was the business area (computers) stunk like someone stored used diapers in there; and the top sheet was stained (I hope) with looked like mascara. I would rather the housekeeping had observed the stain (in the middle of the sheet and easily spotted) and used another than leave it on the bed and hope we didn't see it... Would definitely stay here again and recommend for all.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, with the Exception of Erratic Water Pressure”
Reviews.Author: JazzSinger8
Reviews.Content: The Wyndham Garden Hotel Baronne Plaza is a well situated hotel at a reasonable price. It is within walking distance of Bourbon Street, the riverfront area, the Superdome, and New Orleans Arena. I got it for $120 a night, which is not bad for a nice, downtown hotel. Parking is $20 per night plus tax, which again, is not bad for downtown. Please note that the parking garage is small and not suited for anything larger than a mid-sized car. I found the hotel to be very clean and quiet. I requested that my room be cleaned by noon, and my request was accommodated. I never heard any noise outside my room. My room faced the interior of the hotel, which is plus in New Orleans, because there's always activity on the streets. The bed was comfortable, and I slept well. There was a flat-screen TV that actually got a few HD channels, which is something I've never had in a hotel room. Lastly, I loved the single-cup coffee maker in the room. Ok, so why 4 stars and not 5? It has everything to do with the title of this review. The water pressure in the shower is erratic. About every 20-30 seconds, it goes down to a trickle, and after a few seconds, it returns to normal. It's not a huge deal, but it quickly gets annoying. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel, especially for people attending events at the Superdome or New Orleans Arena. The water pressure is a minor annoyance and shouldn't keep people away entirely when you consider the upsides I mentioned.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - perfect location”
Reviews.Author: crubegonza
Reviews.Content: I must admit I was a little nervous when my friends booked this hotel because of the low rates, but the rooms were clean and very comfortable. It was just a short 5 minute walk to the French Quarter which was perfect since I think I would have lost my mind if we stayed in the actual Quarter. Staff was very friendly and had great recommendations for restaurants and activities. Only down side was that several of the rooms had windows that face an indoor atrium so you have to keep the curtains drawn at all times and there is no sunlight to speak of. Other than that I would recommend the Wyndam Garden to anyone looking to take a quick weekend trip to NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “8th Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: BigRex
Reviews.Content: Our last minute planning and unwillingness to spend a fortune on a room in New Orleans prompted us to stay at the Baronne Plaza Hotel. This was a great choice!. It has a beautiful marbled lobby and the rest of the hotel is kind of art deco-ish. This place was so quiet - a much needed breath of fresh air after Burbon Street. This hotel is a couple of blocks from Bourbon street, a block from Canal, and short walk to elegant dining, budget meals, and all sorts of restaurants in between. There is a Japanese restaurant/Sushi Bar and coffee house onsite and both appeared to be pretty busy. However, we chose to visit the French Quarter establishments i.e., Cafe du Monde, Ralph & Kacoo's, Pierre Masero's, etc., all were a very short walk from the hotel. The room was clean, the bed was very comfortable (we both slept very well), and the staff was great. Onsite parking was a huge plus. However, the parking lot was not designed for large cars or SUV's. There was a rather large pickup in the parking lot, but I'm not sure how it got in there. Overall, our stay was great. We will definitely stay at the Baronne Plaza Hotel the next time we visit the Big Easy!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull stay”
Reviews.Author: archergirl66_10
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel. I got a great deal on the price online, and wondered about the quality, but it was clearly just beautifully redone by Wyndham. It was only a block from the French Quarter, but far enough from Cannal Street that it was quiet. I couldn't believe how comfortable the beds were. I would definitley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Friendly Staff, Minutes away from all the good stuff”
Reviews.Author: Destinista777
Reviews.Content: ( Location was great! At first I thought it might have been a little far off from everything like Bourbon, Canal and the French Quarter..but it wasn't. Harrah's casino and The Riverwalk shops are a bit further, but once you get on Canal street..nothing seems far at all.) From the first day we got there, we were treated great by the staff! Check in wasn't until 3pm, but we got there around 11am. We were told there were no rooms available at this time, but the nice lady at the front kept checking and a room became available! We didn't have to find anywhere else to go til 3pm check-in...we were able to go to our room and relax right then. It was also nice to have a room with a window view of outside. The other rooms have windows, but the view is of the inside of the hotel...so make sure to request an outside view if you like. The TV, nice flat screen and the beds/pillows were unbelievably comfortable! It was extremely plush..I could have slept there all day and night! The bathroom was nice. We did however have a problem with the water pressure in the shower. It would come out of the shower head full speed, then it would completely stop for about 3 secs, then it would come back on and stop. This would have been a problem if I were in a rush to go somewhere, but since I wasn't it really wasn't too big of a deal. If so, I would have asked for a different room. We were down there for Halloween weekend and on my way out the door with my costume on, I asked the guy at the front desk to use a pair of scissors. He kindly let me borrow them and commented that people had been stopping at the desk all night asking to use different items for their costumes. He was really nice. Overall we had a great stay at the Wyndham...I would definitely, definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: audreyrub
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for Halloween weekend on the 3rd floor. We had an inside room, which means no outside window and a king bed. It was the only thing about this hotel we didn't love as you couldn't see outside even by opening the door to the room. The room was otherwise nicely appointed and had the most comfortable hotel bad I ever slept in. The staff was warm, friendly, and helpful with directions, suggestions, and any needs we had. The location was ideal being one block off Canal and one more block off Bourbon. It was safe, affordable,quiet, and comfortable and I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to enjoy the French Quarter but doesn't feel the need to be right in the middle of it. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Wyndham Garden Hotel New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: JakeCarl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wyndham for five days in October 2010. Our room was located on the 5th floor facing the courtyard. We did not have a window facing the street, but this did not bother me, because I'm a very light sleeper. The room was very CLEAN, the bed was VERY comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful, especially Martin and Wesley. The water pressure was low at times, but that was tolerable. Parking was $20 dollars a day, with in and out privileges.The housing keeping staff was excellent. There were two flat screens televisons in the room, and the bathroom was spacious. The hotel is only two blocks from Burbon street. I will stay in this hotel again, on our next vacation in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in the City”
Reviews.Author: Elana31
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a reasonably priced hotel in order to attend a conference in new Orleans. The Wyndham Garden Hotel was the only thing I found in my price range that didn't look sketchy and I was quite pleasantly surprised. Everything at the hotel- the lobby, room, service, etc. was everything I could possibly have expected and the price was much lower than comparable hotels in the same neighborhood. I highly recommend the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and great service”
Reviews.Author: h2os4travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights for a long weekend vacation. It was convenient to most local attractions. We walked every where and felt safe. Our room was clean and quiet. The room overlooked the atrium so no sounds from the streets. The staff were very helpful and pleasant. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Wonderful Stay While in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: debbiekennedy
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean and comfortable. Rooms are spacious and well maintained. Service was excellent. Staying in New Orleans with friends who are actually staying on Bourbon Street, Three blocks away. They paid double the amount of money for their room and very dissatisfied with quality. Would highly recommend staying here at the Wyndham and walking the short distance to Bourban Street for the expierience.

Reviews.Title: “Room stunk like mildew and wet dog.”
Reviews.Author: felonvandal
Reviews.Content: Some girlfriends and I went one weekend for 2 of our friends birthday,luckily we only stayed Saturday night because I dont think I could have stayed for 2 nights.The first room they put us in smelled like mildew and wet dog.The girl at the front desk was very nice and moved us to another room.The room wasnt very clean.The bathroom trash wasnt emptied,there was a little bit of toilet paper on the roll.Instead of putting a new roll they just folded the end of the roll to make it look nice.The water pressure in the shower would come and go and the towels were very small.The ice machines were out on 3 of the 5 floors so you had to wait in line to get ice.The ice bucket or the cups werent wrapped in plastic like most hotels.The room overall wasnt very clean.There was a nice T.V. and the beds were comfortable.The rooms were renovated but the carpet wasnt and it looked very old and dirty.The safe battery was low and it wouldnt work and the radio wouldnt work and it had no CD player.We didnt say anything about these things b/c we were only staying there one night.The staff was very nice and friendly.I guess we were expecting it to be nicer b/c it was a Wyndham hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: edlver
Reviews.Content: the hotel was nice but the location was fantastic, 2 blocks off of bourbon street. Rooms were very comfortable. I did let the front desk know the water was not very hot and the tub was not draining well. it was fixed immediately. I will definitely look at staying at this hotel when i next go to new orleans

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with an Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Raischelle
Reviews.Content: I found this to be a beautiful, clean hotel with a great location (just two blocks from the French Quarter) and exceptional staff. We were always greeted warmly upon entering and exiting the hotel and the staff provided us with accurate directions whenever asked. They really went above and beyond to make our stay enjoyable. My husband's laptop could not work on the hotel's wireless network so the hotel manager provided him with an ethernet cable to use during our stay. In addition, one of the front desk clerks even allowed my husband to use her personal cell phone because he was unable to get a signal while in the hotel's business center. I would definitely stay at the Wyndham Garden again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: WorldJetSetter26
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect, clean, nice rooms, fresh linens & towels with bath products. Free wireless internet in rooms. Friendly staff that have a lot of information about the city. I arrived just before the first Saints game of the season kicked off so the atmosphere in the city was electric and the staff told me everything I want to know! Location is a 5min walk to Bourbon St, Jackson Square & all attractions. I would stay again no complaints, I had a fab stay and time in NO!!

Reviews.Title: “Close enough, but far enough from the noise”
Reviews.Author: KS621
Reviews.Content: the hotel served its purpose, close enough for a short walk to Bourbon Street...but far enough that we didn't hear it. The beds were beyond comfortable and clean, bathroom was clean, curtains blocked out all traces of the sun too help our morning after. over all I highly suggest :) only downside was the surprise parking fee not mentioned anywhere on the site.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: aczgirl
Reviews.Content: I got a great price for this hotel and was not disappointed. The front desk service was quick and easy. Our room was clean and the beds were so comfortable. We had a room with an outside window and my only complaint is the noise from the street on our first night because of the Saints game. Fortunately we did not have that problem the other two nights of our stay. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service in a wonderful Art-Deco Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dmstearns
Reviews.Content: This property is located right off the French Quarter, within walking distance to the Quarter and Central Business District, streetcar lines, Canal Street and the Riverwalk. The lobby and common areas are clean and beautiful in an Art-Deco style, with lots of art work. The Front Desk Staff went well above board to make our stay enjoyable, providing information about the area and were extremly personable (remembered our names, called the room to see if we had everything, etc). It appears that many rooms are being upgraded. Our room was comfortable, clean, and nicely furnished. This is by far, one of the nicest places we have ever stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mjmami137
Reviews.Content: This hotel has one of the best locations you could ask for...within walking distance to just about everything! And if you get tired of walking, the nearby trolly is a great way to get around! The room here was very clean and the employees very pleasant.The only thing I would say was missing was a pool~wouldve been nice in the humidity,but with all of the interesting things to do in New Orleans you may not find the time for it anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Great ventilation”
Reviews.Author: Lexuslady54
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a very open floor plan and GREAT ventilation. Lots of New Orleans hotels are dry and stuffy. I could actually breathe at night. Staff very friendly, rooms clean and inviting. Only drawback was garage...I own an Expedition...too large for garage...top rails hit ceiling. Will come back in smaller vehicle. Will return later in the month for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “My time in the N.O”
Reviews.Author: tvalent1
Reviews.Content: i thoroughly enjoyed my stay here at the Baronne Plaza Hotel. Although i was here on business the hotel was located in a GREAT location, close to major tourist attractions (Bourbon St, Aquarium, Convention Center ect.) The room was spacious and clean. The only issue i had was with the time housekeeping came to clean. I always seemed to have bad timing LOL! All in all the staff was a great help in providing directions and assistanting with transportation needs. I would recommend this hotel to family and friends. Toni V

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location, friendly staff, very clean.”
Reviews.Author: mbem1234
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great. I especially liked its location which is not even 5 minutes walk from Bourbon Street. The French quarter and most of the museums are also walking distance. The service was great, the staff was friendly. Very clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in NOLA!”
Reviews.Author: girlydubbs
Reviews.Content: Very close walk to the French Quarter. Very nice decor in the rooms and the beds are amazing. We slept like babies! We had a street view room and the road noise wasn't bad, either. I would stay here again in a heart beat!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great manager”
Reviews.Author: barrott
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was conveniently located to Bourbon St and all the fun. There was no outside window in the room, which didn't bother us....we were able to sleep late with no sun coming in the window. The room was not the largest, but was very clean. The bed was extremely comfortable. The service was amazing. John in particular was extremely helpful. We were please with his expertise on New Orleans. He helped guide us to the best tours to see the plantations and swamp tours that were spectacular. John also led us to great restaurants and hot spots. He remember to ask about our travels when we got back each day, and just seemed to always want to make sure we were having a great time. If i had to sum it up, I would say that the best thing about the hotel was John and his amazing service, plus the convenient location, and also the price!!. The only thing that could have made it better is if we could have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean Hotel, only a block from Bourbon Street”
Reviews.Author: GaryGToronto
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Baronne Plaza from July 22 to 25, 2010. People should know that they have recently purchased a Wyndam franchise, so I don't know if the name will stay the same. My first experience with the hotel came the day before check in when I called them to inquire as to the best way to get there from the airport. The staff member advised by taxi, and knew the rates of cabs and shuttles etc. He also said that they could help out with the various tours available. We arrived quite early (11 am or so) but a room was ready. The check was very smooth with friendly staff. The room was very good. It was clean, seemed to have a new mattress, because it was very comfortable. The bathroom seemed to have been renovated recently, was clean and well appointed. There was no problem with either hot water or water pressure. The air conditioning worked almost too well. The hotel was converted many years ago from a Sears Store, so the layout is different. Many of the rooms have windows that only open to an indoor atrium. It seems odd that you have to get dressed and go downstairs to see the weather. (Not bad for me as I'm a smoker, so have to go out for my first "fix" of the day anyway) lol The hotel is only a block from the French Quarter and Bourbon Street, so you are close enough to the action, and just far enough away that there is no noise to bother you. There was a continental breakfast with a charge of I think $5.00 or so, but it didn't look that great to me. The front desk staff advised of a couple of good breakfast places in the area though. It was nice that on virtually every arrival back to the hotel a staff member greeted us. This gave a good feeling of security, and obviously that of being a valued customer. All in all this was a good hotel, that I would have no problem recommending for another visit.

Reviews.Title: “A refreshing week of great service and comfortable rooms in New Orleans.”
Reviews.Author: JoelColumbiaFalls_MT
Reviews.Content: Many times when traveling with a large group, check-in is a challenge. At Baronne Plaza, the staff was ready for us and checked our group in without incident. The continuing service throughout the 7 days we stayed was exceptional. We especially appreciated the all night security that was seen in the hotel. The beds were remarkably comfortable with clean and spacious bathrooms included. The Baronne Plaza Hotel helped make our stay in New Orleans one to remember with fond memories.

Reviews.Title: “Be very sure before you make your reservation!!”
Reviews.Author: naomi727
Reviews.Content: Recently, I reserved a room for 3 nights at the Baronne Plaza Hotel to attend the Essence Music Festival. Unfortunately, because of a family medical emergency, I cancelled my travel plans to New Orleans AND took a 4 month unpaid leave of absence from my job. I initially contacted the hotel 28 days before my scheduled check-in date but was told that because of the hotel's 30-day cancellation policy, I would be charged the full $1200 and would not be refunded any of my money. I spent the next 3 weeks attempting to contact various members of the administration staff, including Wendy Lee, accounting director, and John Lofton, general manager for the hotel. I FAX'd a detailed letter to Ms. Lee explaining my situation, as well as letters from my employer, and physician. NO ONE returned my numerous phone calls nor responded to my FAX'd letter. And, of course, I was not refunded my money, despite the fact that close to 40,000 people attended the Essence Music Festival completely saturating the city hotel market. The Baronne Plaza most likely filled my room and charged the guest much more than I paid - so they were paid twice for the room. In summary, with more than a 100 hotels available in the New Orleans area, I would STRONGLY discourage you from staying at the Baronne Plaza. If the lack of compassion shown to me by the managers is any reflection of the hotel's treatment of it's guests, you should definitely save yourself the headache and stay someplace else!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean an affordable.”
Reviews.Author: kenfc
Reviews.Content: My friends and I found the Baronne Hotel staff to be friendly and helpful, The room was clean and adequate. The hotel was close to public transportation, Canal St., and Bourbon St. Room rates were resonable. I would definitely go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: belandseb
Reviews.Content: The location and value of this hotel could not be beat. It was a much more better alternative than staying in the French Quarter where the daily rates were almost double. The hotel was a very short walk to all the sights. The staff were very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. As others have mentioned, the hotel had gone through some renovations, with an updated bathroom and flat screen TVs. They also provide free Wi-Fi in all of the rooms. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!”
Reviews.Author: iwthomas
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel and it was as fabulous as the first.The location is absolutely perfect!!! From reseversation to checkout, every transaction was smooth, easy, and quick. I appreciate that so much because it's VERY hard to find that. I'm also in customer service and appreciate it when what I give is given back somewhere else. THANKS SOOOO MUCH! I look forward to my future stays!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very clean”
Reviews.Author: melmorton88
Reviews.Content: This hotel was apparently recently renovated, and you can tell. It was very nice, clean, and new looking with style. The rooms were average hotel rooms. The only downfall with our entire stay was 2 of the 5 rooms did not have windows. The location is amazing. It's quiet but close enough to walk to Bourbon in less than 5 minutes. The service was great as well. They also have a sushi bar connected to the lobby, great people. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent overall value.”
Reviews.Author: Herndonrules
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel during the second weekend of Jazz Fest. Our party has been coming to Jazz Fest for almost ten years, and scours the web several months prior to the event searching for moderate priced hotels in the Central Business District. This was our first visit to the Baronne Plaza. First, the location is outstanding for those who want to be close to, but not sleeping with, the action in the Quarter. An easy five minute walk puts you in the heart of this activity. From a price standpoint, the hotel was easily the best price for comparable type lodging that we found. My room was clean, smelled fresh and, had a modern bathroom with a forceful shower with quick water heat up. The room was serviced promptly and thoroughly each day. It was not the largest, but, if one doesn't intend to spend a whole lot of time in the room other than sleep and shower, who cares? Our floor was very quiet, and I never heard a sound from any other room. Our interactions with staff were pleasant and they seemed generally helpful, though one minor issue came when I asked to change a $100 bill and it could not be accomplished. This was unfortunate as the lobby ATM had a $3.50 fee. We asked for some directions one day which were accurate and delivered with a smile. Front desk personnel arranged for a cab to drive us to MSY the final morning, and the cab was out front of the hotel, right on time. The breakfast looked OK, but recommend, if you have time, you check out "Mothers" or "Daisy Duke's" for relatively close by home cooked type breakfasts. There is a good convenience store, "Brother's Chicken", one block down selling all kinds of drinks, snacks, etc., as well as some pretty decent take out fried chicken. There is a large Wallgreens also a block down. The hotel seemed to lack a bar, but in New Orleans I don't need to hang out in a hotel bar anyway. Overall, a very good deal and, IMO, as good, or better, than any comparable place (price and amenities wises) I've stayed in New Orleans (ie: Hampton Inn, Holiday Inn Express, Queen and Crescent, Cotton Exchange, etc.). If we can get a similar price next year, we will likely choose this over other similar hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional value”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter33388
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference at one of the fancier business hotels but stayed at the Baronne Plaza when the other property was booked up. This is nothing fancy, but the beds are comfortable, my room was very quiet, and the location can't be beat. The total tab for three nights was the same as one night would have been at my conference hotel. The public spaces are a bit spartan, and the exercise room is pitiful, but it is walking distance from every tourist attraction and three minutes from the French Quarter. Free, fast wireless internet in every room. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it (a locals review)”
Reviews.Author: Slidell2
Reviews.Content: I live 30 miles away but wanted to try this place out when I didn't want to drive home 1). Rooms are overpriced for they are. 2) king bed rooms have windows INTO the hotel. 3). All the buttons were missing from the phone. 4). Wireless was horrid. 5) I reserved 2 kings but they tried to put me in a double and I had to fight for the rooms I reserved. 6). The toiled wasn't sealed on the bottom and there were fecal stains on the surrounding tile. 7). Attached restaurant does not have liquor license so you have to go elsewhere if you want a quick drink at the hotel. I live here and have stayed at MANY better places for the price. This is in NO way 3 star hotel and I do not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep well just off bourbon st.”
Reviews.Author: jface86
Reviews.Content: The best slepp i got after partying! this place is two blocks away from bourbon, right next to Canal which takes to to the trams, the casino and a ton of shops. This hotel is right next to Brothers chicken (which is awasome) and is out of the loudness of the main streets. Also right next to a church (the historical first church of new orleans) for sunday mass. And also free intertnet!

Reviews.Title: “INAPPROPRIATE”
Reviews.Author: acrobert
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at this hotel during a bachelorette weekend. I must say, we were pleasantly surprised with the rooms upon arrival, as they were very spacious and the beds were very comfortable. HOWEVER......our views quickly changed. The sound barriers in this hotel are non-existent. We could not sleep at all, as we were able to hear EVERYTHING coming from our neighbor's room and it was very inappropriate and filthy. This lasted from 3am--8am. We called security 3 times and nothing was done. Had we had kids in the room, we would have had to leave the room. When we complained to the manager the next morning, he seemed indifferent. He said that things like that happen in hotels across the country and it was not the hotel's fault. Yes, things like that do happen I am sure, however, most hotels have better sound barriers and you cannot hear it. Our room was barely discounted and he kind of laughed it off. The fact that this woke up 4 girls after a night of partying, speaks volumes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...Comfortable & Close to Everything!!!!”
Reviews.Author: wildchild6378
Reviews.Content: Arrived early and staff was very quick in finding us an available room... was 'beyond' pleased with renovated room... gorgeous spacious bathroom, flat screen TV and the 'MOST COMFORTABLE & PLUSH' mattress we have ever had the pleasure of sleeping on in a hotel...one of the few hotels that has self parking in the area whcih was very helpful when we wanted to venture outside of the French Quarter...located in a very safe location only a block away from French Quarter (bout 2 blks from Bourbon St)...had an amazing stay...no problems..and was pleasantly surprised to find out that even their parking charges were cheaper than other hotels in the area :)

Reviews.Title: “bad experience”
Reviews.Author: NoviceNomad
Reviews.Content: I had bad experience using booking with hotels.com and baronne plaza. They do not let you change your reservation dates. I verified my reservation by calling them personally, but when I got there they had no record of it. I had to pay for an extra night, ruined my whole trip. So if you think that you may want to change your reservation dates DO NOT stay here. I really hope this will help others in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great value with some serious qualms”
Reviews.Author: Ingmar53
Reviews.Content: This retro-fitted 1931 Sears department store is in a very good location just one block off Canal, making it a short walk to the French Quarter. The art deco qualities of the original building have been maintained and echoed in the newer interior construction. The downside of turning a big-box store into a hotel is that many of the rooms have windows that face only onto a hallway or the interior atrium that has been carved out of the center. On the positive side, you are protected from outside city noises; on the negative side, you never know if it's day or night, sunny or rainy. The other downside is that these interior rooms have no bathroom ventilation, so mirrors steam up instantly during a shower and bathroom smells do not easily dissipate. We got a great deal through Expedia the week after Mardi Gras ($54 per weeknight for a room with king-size bed), and for the first part of our stay we seemed to be among only a handful of guests. But then the weekend guests arrived... perpetually drunk 20-somethings who loudly roamed the halls pounding on random doors. I suspect this is a common problem for any hotel offering cut-rates in proximity of Bourbon Street on weekends. Other positives... the bed was very comfortable, and the rooms have flat-screen TVs and free wi-fi. Other negatives: the cheesiest made-in-India soap and amenities. There is a not-very-inviting sushi restaurant off the lobby. People have complained of bad service, but we found desk staff mostly very friendly and accommodating. The big negative for us... negative enough that I'd likely not stay there again... is that while waiting in the lobby for an early morning taxi to the airport, the security guard (keeping an eye on the comings and going of the drunken young people from the concierge station) volunteered his extreme ANTI-GAY sentiments to us uninvited. That man has no business working in the "hospitality industry."

Reviews.Title: “Great room at a great price”
Reviews.Author: xanowang
Reviews.Content: I stayed there 4 nights on my honeymoon. The hotel is located right in the middle of everything. I can walk to most attractions. The hotel management upgraded our hotel room for free since it was our honeymoon. My wife and I love the place, we will certainly stay there on our next visit to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST SERVICE I HAVE EVER RECEIVED!”
Reviews.Author: easytravellerUsa
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here, not even if it is the last place on earth! I waited 20 minutes to check in at the front desk. This wasn't the worst of the check-in... When i called ahead, they told me to park in-front of the hotel and come inside to check-in then they will take me down to the parking garage. While I was checking-in, I got a ticket from the police for parking where THEY TOLD ME TO PARK! Then, also while checking in, another guest came to ask for a good place to eat at. The person who was checking me in told him to come speak to him later when he wasn't busy. In a very rude tone. I could not believe it and never thought I would get service like that... Wait a little while, read on, i get service worse than that! I eventually got into the room (After the staff told me that me getting a ticket was not their fault at all) and found that the pressure in the shower would go from stong to weak to nearly non-existant in cycles, every minute or so. I noticed hairs in the bed (all over!) and the walls between the rooms are dry walls so you can hear EVERYTHING from the rooms next door to you. I had booked a 3 day stay and called down to the front desk to ask about their policy if I wanted to leave after 2 days - weather I would get my money back for the third day or not... The person at the front desk said over the phone, ''Come down to the front desk and talk to me, I am far to busy right now to deal with this.'' He then put the phone down. I could not believe it! DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL. IT IS THE WORST ONE OF THE LOT.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Stay for NFC Championship.”
Reviews.Author: Cdining
Reviews.Content: Despite some recent reviews our recent stay at this hotel was wonderful. We traveled with another couple for the NFC Championship game and found our rooms to be very clean and comfy. Upon check-in the air in our friends room was not working but within a few minutes of contacting the front desk they were there and resolved the matter very promptly. The parking is underground and kind of tight but the location provides easy access to the Dome and the French Quarter which makes for easy walking. The lobby was beautiful and a very quaint hotel with a great value. Only complaint would be that the room keys had to keep being reprogrammed and a very dated (paper) check-in system.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your own sheets and household cleaners”
Reviews.Author: mwb1982
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1. Close to Bourbon Street, but far enough away to sleep soundly. 2. Front desk staff responded very, very quickly to my complaint and made me feel at ease. Cons: 1. Parking is expensive ($35/day??), inconvenient and there aren't enough spaces to accommodate guests; you can park for $20/day at the parking garage around the corner on University Place. 2. The hotel clearly states it's a nonsmoking facility, but I saw a guest smoke in the hallway while speaking to a hotel employee. The smoke seeped through my room. 3. Housekeeping is a JOKE. I found hairs in the bathtub, bathroom sink, and the coffee mug. I also found a pubic hair on the toilet seat (disgusting!) and a dead spider in the ice box. There was also a white stain on the black office chair that looks suspiciously like a bodily liquid I dare not say. I found blood stains on the comforter. 4. I had to run the water for about 45 minutes - 1 hour for the hot water to start; even then, the water pressure would go in and out, and the water would turn off about 5 times in the duration of my shower. I thought that maybe since the hotel was packed that day that it was normal for the water pressure to fluctuate. But no, this happened during my entire 3-night stay, no matter what time it was. 5. The bathroom outlet wasn't functioning. 6. I paid about $200/night for all these cons.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Great Location, New Renovations”
Reviews.Author: vacationer789
Reviews.Content: During a recent "girl's weekend" we stayed in the Baronne Plaza. After reading many reviews, I was a little weary. But still decided to stay at the Baronne. I booked through the hotel online and received the November specials rate. The room came at a very reasonable price. The outside of the building is nothing spectacular, however the lobby and the interior decorations of the lobby and sitting area really make up for the exterior of the building. There is a parking garage underneath the building. The garage is convenient as you have easy access to your vehicle at any time you want and you have the comfort of knowing it is not parked in a parking garage some four blocks away. The hotel has been very recently renovated and it looks great. The rooms are very clean and large. We stayed in a room with two double beds and an outside view (it seems as if these might be a bit larger). There was a desk, a chair, an ottoman, and a flat screen TV. A huge plus - the large amounts of electrical outlets in the room (a plus for four girls!) The bathroom was nice as well. The towels weren't that large, but when we asked for more immediately housekeeping arrived with some. The bed and pillow are unbelievably comfortable! No parts of the room seemed unclean or unkept. My ONLY complaint is that I could not connect to wireless in my room. There were many (about 20) signals that my computer picked up on, but none were even a little strong enough to work. However, I went down to the lobby and picked up on a strong signal. The free breakfast in the morning was yummy! Coffee, juice, milk, bagels, waffles, eggs, bacon, cereal, fruit, etc. The staff at the hotel and the breakfast are very friendly. The hotel's restaurant opened the Saturday night of our stay, but we did not try it. It is a sushi restaurant and smelled tasty! During our stay one morning, a few rooms down from ours, a group of men and women began arguing VERY loudly in the hall. This was around 8:00 in the morning. Very quickly, the hotel staff took care of this problem and called the police who immediately came and seemed to be issuing tickets. I was quite impressed with the way the hotel handled the disturbance. The Baronne Plaza is only about 3 blocks from Bourbon and just one block from Canal. We walked to the square a few times easily in about 15 minutes. The location is safe and located around many other hotels. There is also a Walgreen's only one block from the hotel on Canal street. A subway and a few finer restaurants are also located within one block of the hotel. I would recommend this hotel to families, friends, and anyone looking for a clean, reasonably priced location. It does not have all the bells and whistles of some of the more fancy hotels (no bellman, no pool or hot tub, no luxurious decorating), but the hotel is an awesome deal for the price you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Not ready for prime time”
Reviews.Author: NolaGal13
Reviews.Content: when I booked it, its Website said it offered a Business Center, and in October, its in-room Guest Directory said this. There wasnâ€™t any. Its Website says â€œNew Orleans Airport Shuttle Service: $15.00â€� the in-room Guest Directory said it was $10), but when I called them in September to book, they referred me to a general shuttle service for $38 roundtrip. I was going to attend a number of group events at restaurants during my stay where weâ€™d all settle up the final bill for cash, so I brought travellersâ€™ cheques because plastic wouldnâ€™t do. I was NEVER able to cash a travellersâ€™ cheque at the Front Deskâ€”the excuse was always that no one had paid them any cash yet that day!! Iâ€™ve never been in a hotel or even a motel where I couldnâ€™t cash a travellersâ€™ check. Being a weekend, the banks were closed and I was up a creek. The â€œfree safeâ€� didnâ€™t lock in the first room they put me in (they wanted me to use the Front Deskâ€™s safe deposit boxes; I insisted on a room with a working safe). In that room, the remote control didnâ€™t operate the TV; I had to wait until someone came to program it. The Front Desk manager always looked like a touristâ€”dressed in slacks and a short-sleeved sport shirt, and he was not very concerned with customer service. There was no in-hotel food service!!!!! The entire lobby was under reconstruction, so both the restaurant and were shuttered. Any sensible hotel would have set up a complimentary 24-hour coffee and donut bar to compensate, but this place referred guests to the nearest off-site coffee shop. Another indicator of how off-base they are is that their time-zone clock for New York City showed the correct time for Denver. When I pointed this out, I got a blank stare. This is all a great shame because the rooms ARE newly renovated as their Website says and both the rooms and corridors look very, very nice and the beds were comfy. The towels were, however, very skimpy, and my cold sink faucet always dispensed warm water (nasty for brushing your teeth). Also, most (maybe all) rooms donâ€™t have outside windows; instead they have windows onto the central court of the building.

Reviews.Title: “OK but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: alkel18
Reviews.Content: We were in town for the Giants game and with two other conventions in town that weekend, were not able to get a great deal on a hotel like we usually do. We wound up at the Baronne because we had 15 people and just needed a place to sleep for a reasonable price and the options were low this particular weekend. We wound up in a handicapped-accessible room so our stay was a bit better than the others we stayed with due to the size of the room and bathroom, but the other rooms were definitely small and had no windows. I have to say the rooms and beds were a bit nicer than I expected due to the recent renovation and it was very clean so that was good. The main part of the hotel is going through a renovation so its a bit weird that everything in the lobby is a mess but it really didn't affect us much. The location is good, just a block from Canal St I think and few blocks to all the craziness on Bourbon. If I had to stay there again due to lack of availability for better hotels I would, but the last time we managed to get a cheaper rate at the JW Marriott so obviously had better value on that trip. We did get to a great dinner while we were there at Cochone, I definitely recommend that place. The food was outstanding and they were definitely accommodating for a large group. We also went to DBA the last night on Frenchman Street and had a great time with the live band, definitely was a great bar.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and clean”
Reviews.Author: pinems
Reviews.Content: The only reason I gave this hotel a 4 star and not 5 is because it is under rennovation. The poor reviews must be from those who stayed before the rennovation because the rooms were cleans and updated with marble bathroom and flat screen tv's. The location is great also..minutes away from everything.

Reviews.Title: “good location, good value, nice stay”
Reviews.Author: westdogg2140
Reviews.Content: location was great, just a short walk to canal and bourbon street, as well as superdome and casinos. hotel staff was friendly and accomodating. remodeling interior, which wasn't important to our group of mid 20's party'ers. rooms varied in size, all had nice flat screen. good bang for your buck. i'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I was impressed!”
Reviews.Author: burgerbusters
Reviews.Content: I couldn't find a room in the city because there was a convention in town that week, but at the last minute they had an opeing. The room was pretty nice and the staff were really into helping me when I had questions. I didn't see a restaurant, but they said they were in the process of opening one. They also had meeting rooms under construction, so looks like they're making this hotel more updated. I can say I will be back for sure next year!

Reviews.Title: “VERY nice!”
Reviews.Author: Girlsouth9
Reviews.Content: I made this reservation very last minute - in fact the day before we arrived. Then I read some reviews and began to doubt and hope for the best. Relax your fears - the hotel is under renovation - but that is only good for you. Whatever issues were there, they must have been addressed. The rooms were completely remodeled and extremely nice. Beds - wunnerful!!! There are some incomplete areas still being worked on - but the rooms were totally quiet and we never heard any construction going on. Call the hotel directly if you want to know about lobby being complete or weight room completed. We weren't sleeping in those spots anyway! Staff was very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “complete joke - stay somewhere else you have been warned. See my photos.”
Reviews.Author: chrisuk1000
Reviews.Content: Firstly the hotel is under major construction!!! If anyone had bothered to tell us when we booked up that we would be entering a building site like this I would have told them to go take a hike (thatâ€™s the polite version). Oh.... maybe thatâ€™s why they neglected to mention that bit, silly me? Lets just pretend its all nice and cosy and we won't lose any money eh, bad, bad, bad! I have taken some photos because I want you to see for yourself what a little refurbishment work actually looks like, please do take a peak. "Oh sorry the restaurant is closed too, the refurbishment you see" said the polite receptionist....grr forgot to mention that to us as well. "Its going ***s up" I said to my dumbstruck partner! Actually we just turned to each other and burst out laughing thatâ€™s what can happen when you are left in disbelief. So bomb site at reception, no food what next............. well cockroaches!!!!! yes the little blighters are here in numbers, but wait they are dying so thatâ€™s okay because they've been treated obviously (I suppose they could have starved because the restaurant's shut remember) well guess what they were here in the same spots day after day after day.....oh my god nobody is bothering to clean up! Think I'm joking don't you? Well there were dead insect bodies, rubbish and litter lying around for three days, all in the exact same places, bad, bad, bad. I know because I photographed it. Yes I'm ashamed of being so sad but by the time I was leaving I was desperate for revenge. Me bitter???? definitely. I knew people wouldn't believe me unless I could show them anyway so I started to photograph everything. I had visions of some manager coming on here and trying to say I was a liar or exaggerating you know how they like to play things down, Its business remember. Well the pictures are there you decide. The rooms themselves are more like cold, miserable, caves, with the bare essentials in. Actually it's all garbage the only plus point is the staff, they are really nice. I feel sorry for them having to explain this joke to every customer who comes through the door. I really do. Anyway I've had my say, thank goodness for sites like trip advisor, hopefully a lot of you will be put off and find somewhere not under refurbishment for your stay. New Orleans and its folk are really lovely, the Baronne Plaza most definitely is not! Don't go it's a complete insult to your intelligence. Bitter and vengeful, Chris. Note - Iâ€™ve just returned from a tour in America and I stayed at 12 different hotels, this hotel doesnâ€™t even merit a last place amongst them, itâ€™s three below that spot! What I really mean is I have a few comparisons to back up what Iâ€˜m talking about. I just donâ€™t want people to be disappointed like we were afterall you are paying so much money. Top tour for me was the Cajun Adventura swamp trip, loved it. Takes a morning and they pick you up at the door. The VIP city tour was okay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by "free parking".”
Reviews.Author: blondemensan
Reviews.Content: We loved the offer of free parking, but the lot was full when we checked in at 3pm, which is when they begin check-in. We ended up paying $20 to park down the block. On the plus side, the staff was friendly, and the rooms were clean and the beds very comfortable. We did not have a problem with noise from the other rooms. On the down side, the rooms are small, the view is lousy, and it was a long walk to get into the action in the French Quarter. The lobby is under construction, so there is no bar or restaurant, and the lobby is full of drop cloths. This is a good place to stay if you are on a tight budget, but plan to pay to park.

Reviews.Title: “A bit weird, but comfortable and good value”
Reviews.Author: flyermontana
Reviews.Content: This hotel is under construction right now, and has a strange look on the inside--it still kind of seems like a cavernous mall and feels rather deserted. The room I had was very clean and tasteful, very comfortable bed, nice flat screen TV. But doors were slamming all night and the walls seemed very thin. I could hear everything said in the room next to me, and in the morning the construction crews started up their work and that was LOUD. I got a pretty good value on Orbitz and definitely saved a lot by not staying at the Marriott a few blocks away, which was where I was attending a conference. The location of the Baronne is great--just off Canal Street so a little quieter and just as convenient. My biggest complaint about this hotel is that the Internet connection (wireless) is SO frustrating. It went in and out all night, and I really needed it in order to prepare my conference presentation. Anything needing a sustained connection was impossible to do. I complained and the staff was rude about it, saying "It must be your computer." Also, one night I came back late to find my door key no longer worked. The front desk person was not very helpful and seemed to think I was trying to get away with something?? She said maybe someone was in my room and had locked me out--which kind of freaked me out. It just took a lot longer than it should have for them to give me another key...annoying. But overall, this is a good place to stay and will only get better when the renovations are complete.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay for an afforable price”
Reviews.Author: travelcarib
Reviews.Content: PROS: The rooms were vice nice for the pirce you paid. Be sure to ask for a room with windows facing the exterior (as opposed to the interior of the building). There is a flat screen tv an up-to-date furnishings in the room. The staff were very pleasant and personable. I was having an issue with the TV and telephone in the room at 2am in the morning and they sent maintenance up there to fix it right away. CONS: Housekeeping has the tendency to nag you when it comes to cleaning the room. If you tell them to come back in and hr or so, they will have front desk call you [again] and inform you that the housekeeper will be leaving at 3pm today, therefore she needed a specific return time. This was quite annoying when someone was tryign to sleep in late. The most troubling experince is the fact the the hallway/lobby/lounge/elevantors smelt VERY stuffy and musty.
