The air was filled with dust as a result of the renovations going on in the common areas. I would recommned that the hotel use only one elevator for cargo as it is quite an unpleasant experience to ride in such a close-knit space with so much dust. All in all, if you can bare the few cons of this hotel, I would recommend it as "stayable" for an affordable price. I am sure that the dust issue will be resolved as soon as they complete renovations. It the hotel is also located 2 blocks away from Bourbon Street so it is very convenient. However, the street is very dark and lonely to way to and from the central spots.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms for the price”
Reviews.Author: JTown
Reviews.Content: We stayed here March 27th and 28th. The hotel lobby is being updated, so there were some miscellaneous building materials scattered around the corners of the lobby. The receptionist was friendly and the check in went smoothly. Our room was on the third floor and was very clean. The room had been recently updated and had a nice granite bathroom and LCD TV. The bed was soft and comfy. Our room didn't have a window facing outside, it faced into the atrium area. With the blind closed, the room was pitch dark like a cave, so it was nice for sleeping in. The hotel is only two blocks from the corner of Canal and Bourbon St., so it's very convenient to the French Quarter. This hotel doesn't have a pool or restaurant/bar, but it's location makes up for the lack of amenities. We couldn't have asked for a better room for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Variable room sizes, but we had a great stay overall”
Reviews.Author: turfie
Reviews.Content: Wherever we attend our annual large convention, we always look for acceptable less expensive accommodations. The Baronne Hotel 'won out' over all the options we checked. We had 10 executive rooms (9 double and 1 single) for our group. While it was a longer walking distance to the convention center than we normally prefer, a nearby hotel booked for the convention by the organizing program had a free shuttle provided by the organizers. Taxi fares were not too bad from the convention center, when the shuttle was unavailable. Because the hotel is converted from a non-hotel use, rooms were not uniform in size. Some of the double rooms were a bit small and perhaps should have been singles. The largest double room did not have hot enough water (it may have been furthest from the water heater on the floor , but is not unique to this hotel -- I have had this happen at other hotels; check your shower when you arrive and switch rooms, if necessary), but the people in the room stayed there, because they liked having a big room. That being said, we were pleased overall with our rooms. The single I had included a bathroom nearly as big as the rest of the room. The bathroom floors are a marble-like material, so can be a bit cold, but it was better than having tile, which can be difficult to keep clean in the recessed edges of each tile. The 'dresser' was four low drawers that had a padded cushion on top for extra seating in the room for visitors -- a nice feature for when our group gathered. All staff were extremely helpful. Our rooms were clean and the areas outside the rooms were also clean. All our rooms were interior rooms facing out to an atrium open to all floors, with my room being immediately adjacent to the elevator. There was extra noise as people came and went, but not to the point where it disturbed me once I was asleep. The hotel, however, was not as full as during a more popular time like Mardi Gras. With the location near Bourbon street, one should expect more noise than at a hotel further away -- no big deal. The beds were the kind you get in the fanciest hotel, soft and comfortable. They were high, so a short person like myself almost needed a footstool to get in my bed. Once there, however, I could have stayed there all day and night. At night, it was a bit dark for a couple blocks until you reached the main street (Canal), so you might want to walk with someone else, if you don't like less well-lit areas. Construction nearby may have contributed to this being darker than normal. Once the construction is completed there may be more light from the adjacent lot. The wireless internet did not always work for me, but it was nice it was free when it did work. We were all pleased with the rate -- less than $100 a night, including all taxes and fees for executive rooms (albeit without microwave or refrigerator). Next time our convention is in New Orleans, we will definitely check out availability from this hotel. I have a feeling, that as word spreads, availability may go down, but that happens with decent accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Saved us!!”
Reviews.Author: thepen-1
Reviews.Content: A Trip to New Orleans for Mardi Gras landed us in a horrible hotel.(Read review on Canal Street Hotel) The next morning, my friend started making phone calls to area hotels hoping to find a vacancy. The Baronne Plaza Hotel had a vacancy that is reserved for emergencies. After hearing of our predicament, Cynthia, The desk clerk at this hotel not only came to our aid but did everything possible to make our stay as enjoyable as possible. The hotel itself is unbelievable. Apparently it was once the old Sears store now being redone as a hotel. It Is Beautiful inside!! The location is great for walking everywhere downtown and in the French Quarters.The Rooms are spacious and clean and the housekee[ping staff really know their stuff. I am a picky traveler, but this hotel gets a great review from me:} And Cynthia, thanks for saving our vacation:} Glinda reynolds

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at the Baronne Plaza Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fyvekatz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Baronne this past weekend during Mardi Gras and had a positive experience. I chose the hotel for its price and for its proximity to Bourbon St. I had a number of conversations with the staff prior to my arrival as I was managing reservations for a multiple rooms and there were a number of modifications that I needed to make to the reservations as well as confirmations to be managed. Both before my stay and during, the hotel staff was patient, responsive, and courteous even in spite of an incident that occurred when one of my crew partied a little too hard. As for the hotel, itself, it's going through renovations and the block that it is on is kinda...blah. With that said, while the look and the feel of the lobby is merely perfunctory, the rooms appear to have completed their renovations and I was pleased with their quality (i.e, soft bed, flat-screen tv, nice bathroom). I suspect that I got a deal on the room because of the renovations, but it was well worth the price. The hotel, itself, is one block away from Canal St. and the French Quarter and two blocks from the corner of Canal and Bourbon. It's a great location if you want to be close to the main N.O. nightlife and still save a bit of cash. One thing to be on the look out for: the internal rooms have windows that open to the interior of the hotel, itself, which I'm sure some would think is a privacy issue in spite of the fact that they have curtains. You'll want to request a room that opens to the exterior of the hotel. Aside from that, make no mistake that during Mardi Gras, you're going to have a party crowd at this hotel. They'll be up late, and while the noise level was not a problem for me, there are people coming and going (and making some noise) in the middle of the night during Mardi Gras. Would I stay there again? Yep.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: SED84
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be great overall. The hotel is being remodeled, and they are adding three business conference rooms; therefore, there are some furniture boxes sitting around, but the rooms themselves are nicely furnished and well-kept. There is wireless access (although the connection is unsecured). The staff is VERY friendly. The hotel is very close to the French Quarter and the St. Charles Streetcar. It is right off Canal Street, so almost everything is within walking distance. I did have two complaints: (1) The parking. It is $20 per night valet service. If you need to get in and out, you have to stop by the front desk so they can walk outside and push a remote to let the bar up so you can enter and exit. The ramp which leads under the building to the parking garage is very steep. However, if you intend to park and stay there until you leave, it is not that big of a deal. (2) We got the less expensive of the rooms, and these rooms do not include a mini-fridge and microwave. While I understand that these are available in the more expensive rooms, it would still be a nice amenity in every room. Overall it was a great place to stay. Next time, I will spring for the rooms with micro-fridges. I would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed -- Bad Experience -- Read my Review.”
Reviews.Author: AlotofTravels
Reviews.Content: When we pulled up, we were out front, who'd guess that the entrance was far on the right (no signs until try to enter front door), so we had to cart our luggage around the corner. I'd looked on-line and found a parking garage on Gravier St (1 st. up), so after checking-in, I parked in a Ampco Garage ($36 versus the $90 that Baronne would have charged!). Attempting to get ready for the town, we found that the shower about tore threw the wall when turned on (shaking) and took at least 5 min to heat up. Oh and we had the Exec King Suite with the jacuzzi -- or lack thereof! -- it was a small bath tub with little vents on the sides and not even the back. Oh and our Exec King Suite was actually smaller than our friends Double Suite, but ours was $40 more a night!! Hope you're not looking to be pampered, because you're drinking out of styrofoam and the fridge/microwave that is included isn't there -- you have to request it!! Isn't a suite that has two rooms make you think they are separate? They're NOT ... it has a see through half-wall in the middle of the room. Don't expect any privacy in this suite. If all of this wasn't enough, when we'd looked for the room initially on a website, the check-out time was listed as noon. Our friends in the Double Suite were checking out early and called since the desk was saying check-out was at 11am, so we called down to check. It was now 10:45am, and with website print off in hand, I called, "We made a mistake and though check-out was at noon per another website, can we get a late check out or an extra half-hour?" There answer, "NO!! Sorry, but you need to check out at our checkout time of 11am." They wouldn't budge ... and I won't ever budge to go back to this hotel again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fair prices, close to French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: pitterpat7
Reviews.Content: We secured a reservation for $89/night during graduation weekend and received an interior facing room. Renovation work was visible, but nothing was going on during our weekend stay. Overall our stay was quiet, but on Sunday morning you do hear the younger people coming back from the French Quarter. That's going to be expected staying anywhere near the French Quarter though. And since the prices are so reasonable, there are going to be guests from that crowd staying at the hotel. The hotel room itself was clean and tidy, and close walking distance to the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Baronne good value”
Reviews.Author: yaqui
Reviews.Content: May 16-19. We were there for a siblings birthday and the hotel was fine for what we wanted. We paid something like $150.00 total. The staff was friendly and there was construction visible, but we never heard anything. The hotel is easy walking distance to the quarter and away from all the traffic and noise. Really, how much time do you spend in your hotel room in the Big Easy? The hotel was really quiet. There is a great local bar on Baronne a block before Canal where the drinks are cheap and locals are colorful to say the least. Mikes pub and grub I think. A beer at the hotel was like five bucks, plus. Not the nicest place I have stayed, but I was looking for a place to crash after a few drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with the Baronne”
Reviews.Author: MelNJ81
Reviews.Content: Very happy with our five-night stay at the Baronne. Hard to determine why it's so inexpensive and only a two-star. We were nervous after reading the 2-3 reviews regarding stolen items from the room, so we locked our suitcases when we left the room. Hotel was very quiet and we rarely saw other guests. We had a renovated room, with new bed, linens, bathroom and flat panel TV. Only complaint was that we had an interior room. Made waking up torturous. Walk to the Quarter is quick, as is walk down to Fulton Street and the happenings at Harrah's Casino and RiverWalk. Staff members were helpful and pleasant. Lobby grand.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: Sweet_Tiffytaffy1
Reviews.Content: Definitely value for money!! I stayed at the Baronne for 4 nights and I have to say I am somewhat impressed. They are still renovating but I was never disturbed by any noises caused by renovations. The room was newly renovated, clean and spacious enough. I would have loved a window facing outside but I wasn't too bothered by it not having one. It is close to everything so I was very surprised by the pricing. This was my second trip to New Orleans and I was very discouraged after the first because the hotel sucked!! The Baronne certainly changed my mind and I believe that this is where I will be staying each time I come to visit every few months.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not terrific”
Reviews.Author: cringley
Reviews.Content: Let me say at first that I know you should never leave valuables in a hotel room, but while my husband and I stayed at this hotel I hid my wallet very securely in our room. A week after our return home I noticed fraudulent credit card charges on my credit cards that were in this wallet from New Orleans. I called my banks to dispute the charges then called the hotel. Their customer service was so lousy - they transferred me to the Laundry Service twice when I asked to speak with the manager. The person at the front desk was not helpful and again transferred me to their Laundry Service. It was the very helpful person in the Laundry who gave me the manager's name and phone number. When I finally spoke to the manager, he told me that I should file a report with the New Orleans Police Department and to give my valuables to the people at the front desk for safe keeping. We will NOT stay at this hotel ever again. The Police Department provided better customer service than this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Ittiebittie
Reviews.Content: We had four rooms at the Baronne Plaza for the BCS Bowl. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The gentleman who helped us to the room with our luggage went off Baronne St. to another street to hail us a cab so we wouldn't be late for our dinner reservation at Commander's Palace-great service! One young man in our party left his rather expensive jacket when we checked out and the staff was great in locating it and mailing it to him. Two blocks from Bourbon St. - this hotel had great location. I would definitely stay here again. Saw workers replacing burnt out light bulbs in the hallways. Cleaning was satisfactory-the staff seem to take pride in this beautifully renovated old art-deco building.

Reviews.Title: “Loud, but clean and courteous”
Reviews.Author: godawgs321
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and staff was courteous, but very loud pipes and drains, I guess from showers, will wake you early in the morning. The hotel was located in walking distance (2-5 blocks) to Bourbon Street, the Superdome, Harrah's, and many New Orleans attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value-Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: UGADawg83
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights at the Baronne as we attended the Sugar Bowl game. The location is excellent, only two blocks from Bourbon Street and the French Quarter and a short walk to the Superdome. The rooms were reasonable and the staff is very courteous and helpful. One of the desk clerks went above and beyond in making dinner reservations for us on New Years Eve. I will stay there again when visiting New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!! And cheap as hell.”
Reviews.Author: TrinaeSwann
Reviews.Content: Aside from the computer being down, I enjoyed my stay at the Baronne Plaza. The Staff was wonderful and very helpful. I thought the rooms were cozy and welcoming. They are doing a lot of work to the place...post Katrina and all...but for the most part I thought that the service and professionalism was superb. You can't beat the price....

Reviews.Title: “Baronne best for value”
Reviews.Author: peteraquilla
Reviews.Content: Excellent value,clean in every way,staff very helpful,shops and restaurants minutes away,canal street and french quarter 1 block I will certainly stay there again,rooms are spacious and clean,front desk staff very helpful,yes at the baronne plaza you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “overlooked & underrated for those on a budget who need great location”
Reviews.Author: nola_girl76
Reviews.Content: OK, the Baronne Plaza is not the Hilton, so if you're very picky or used to the Four Seasons, then I'd look elsewhere because this place isn't the lap of luxury. Meaning you won't find designer towels and toiletries or a 4 star restaurnt. But it is a very clean, modern hotel, in a great location, at a great price! I've stayed at plenty of hotels in NOLA in this class/price range and I think Baronne Plaza is one of the best. Some comparable hotels, all of which I also recommend, are: The Ambassador, Queen & Crescent, Hotel St Marie, and Prince Conti. My stay at Baronne Plaza was as good or better than those. The price during Mardi Gras was only $139 a night, which is pretty much impossible to come by. I actually still think that there must have been some mistake with the price because it was so cheap considering it was Mardi Gras. The rooms are large and clean and it wasn't loud in there despite it being Mardi Gras. The layout of the place was a bit odd, so be prepared that some rooms don't have windows, That was fine with me because I am a light sleeper, and it was so dark in there that I got some really good sleep. The bathroom was nice, had great water pressure. Huge TV with cable. It was more than adequate, it was nice. The staff was very friendly as well. The security was a bit lacking, they had a system of handing out wristbands to guests to avoid problems with drunken revelers wandering around in there, but they never checked the wristbands. They did however reprgram my keys when I lost one of them. The best thing about the Baronne Plaza, which is a big part of the value, is the location It's on the edge of the French Quarter so it's the best of both worlds: acess to the quarter without actually having to be IN the quarter. And, it's not a sketchy walk back late at night by yourself (not true of say, Amerisuites on Canal; a few blocks can make a huge difference in NOLA in terms of quality of neighborhood.) Anyway, I can't find a single complaint about my stay there, and I'm quite pleased with my discovery. Sorry to all those who paid over $200 for an identical room elsewhere or just to be in the quarter, or even worse, St Vincen'ts Guest House. (see my review of that place.)

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: tj0422
Reviews.Content: my husband and i went for mardi gras. we were there the 16th-18th. We decided 2 weeks before we went that we wanted to go. We found the Baronne Plaza had rooms with no minimum night stay at $150 a night. Which was a lot cheaper than we were finding other places. The front staff was great. I didnt know it was credit only during the mardi gras season, so i only had cash. They accepted it without a problem. the room was clean. Showers were hot. location was GREAT. we could walk back to the hotel from bourbon street and the parade route within minutes. even at 10AM it was very dark in the room. i never woke up because of noise in the hall. the only problem we had was our heater blew out cold instead of hot. they have limited parking, no large vehicles allowed and its $20 a day. but during the mardi gras season you are lucky to find any hotel that is free or cheap. we will definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “It wasn't bad, but...”
Reviews.Author: lesliechelle
Reviews.Content: I don't think my husband and I will be staying here again. - The hotel had annoying "elevator music" playing throughout the hallways and lobby. - The vending machines would not accept dollar bills, coins only! We tried every vending machine on every floor. - NO PARKING! We had to drive around for blocks looking for a place to park. All the parking garages and lots we found were full (as we were visiting for New Year's Eve). We ended up parking by a curb and also ended up with a parking ticket! Available parking may not be important to most, but it is a luxury I cherish whenever I stay in a hotel. I hate to constantly worry about my car whenever I'm out trying to have a good time. As for the rest of the hotel: It was clean enough and the staff was friendly. The outside of the hotel isn't much to look at, but the lobby is impressive.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointed”
Reviews.Author: RainLake
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Barrone Plaza for the weekend. Everything was booked up but we found an inexpensive room at the Barrone Plaza. The Barrone was originaly built for Sears and later converted to the hotel. It is one block off of Canal in the Business District. Location is not bad. The check in staff seemed frindly but parking was a problem. Hotel does not have its own parking so you must find one of the public parking buildings. The closest one is a block from the hotel itself and the cost is $28.00 per night. The hotel seemed safe but the rooms were not very clean and needed updating. Floors were very dirty as was the bathroom. Plumbing fixtures were in very poor shape. There are many better choices to be found. If you must stay only one night the price is right. If you want to stay more than one night, go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed but OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights while I was in New Orleans for a conference. The price was right and the room itself was perfectly fine-- reasonably clean and quiet. There was free wireless access in the room (despite the desk clerks not being aware of it when I asked). The hotel is located centrally-- an easy walk to the French Quarter, other hotels, Convention Center. The downside was that there were large mold stains on the ceiling of my room, the lobby is cavernous, dark and dingy with annoying piped-in music at all hours (and I saw a large cockroach next to the elevator one evening).

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!”
Reviews.Author: EMJ42
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very understaffed. Our room had food crumbs and dirt on the floor. In the bathroom there were some toenail clippings on the floor along with hair. We were told there were only 4 housekeepers for the entire hotel, which is 5 stories tall. Hotel was very dark/dim. You had to park your car in a damp smelly basement that had almost no light to see by. There were no drinks or snacks in any of the machines on all floors. It's been almost a year since Katrina hit, but its obvious that this hotel has not made a comeback. Was so not worth the $140 a night that we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Hurricane Katrina”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was a guest at Baronne Plaza the weekend of Hurricane Katrina. Besides the beautiful amenities of the hotel (the restuarant has an awesome sweet potato omlet), the service was fantastic. The employees at the hotel were in a crisis situation, and people were scared and disorganized. The staff handled everything professinally and treated everyone with respect. It was a safe haven in the midst of chaos. I sincerely hope that all the employees of Baronne Plaza and their familes are safe and well.

Reviews.Title: “Great place no dout, will come back again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife booked the room via the web for her 40th birthday present to herself. When we arrived we were treated very well by the staff and the front desk staff member kept calling us hun, we loved it! We upgraded to the suite with no problems and the room was better that we expected. We were on the 4th floor and never had a problem with service. This place was so quiet that we slept better than at home. We went to take a nap at 7pm so we could go party later on that night and ended up sleeping 12 hours straight. The staff was great and always on top of things and gave us great ideas on things to do. On our last night we asked about a good steak place to eat and we were told about Port of call. This place was great and had the best steak I've ever had, not to mention all the other stuff we had. The location of the hotel was perfect, just about 2 blocks from Bourbon Street. Close enough to come back and relax for a while then go back out. We will be going back and staying here as soon as we can get back.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Kentuckyskier
Reviews.Content: We stayed there Aug. 25-28. Yes, that is the pre-Katrina weekend. Staff: great. Room: clean. Value: the best. This is a budget priced hotel. If you want a $250-$500 room, go somewhere else and pay for it. The Baronne Plaza can't be beat for people that want a bed, bath and convenience. Maids don't come until late, great for morning sleep. Our second floor room, above a busy intersection, was very quiet. We only heard one diesel truck accelerating from the traffic light in three nights. Hope they survive the Katrina mess. This is where I plan to stay during my next trip to New Orleans. When walking to Canal Street, stop in Cajun Mike's and say hello to Kiki. She is the super owner. Tell here some guy from Kentucky sent you.

Reviews.Title: “best value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel between 1st and 5th of august 2005 and we loved it!! For $60 a night I think it's the best value you can find. The hotel is just a block away from the french quarter and the price is great. The inside of the hotel is really nice in art deco style and the staff is really nice and helpful. Most of the room have windows on the hotel lobby which has double advantages: no noise from the street where jazz bands play at any time of the day or night; and no light in the morning which is great when you had a late night on Bourbon street and need some sleep in the morning. Only problems: you discover the weather only when getting out of the hotel, and the parking at $20 a night a bit expensive. Otherwise I would recommend the hotel to everyone. Oh, and there is also a computer room where you can use the hotel computers to surf the web and find good deals around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the moment I walked into the lobby of the Baronne Plaza Hotel I was greeted with a welcoming smile radiating the warmth of southern hospitality. I highly recommend the visitors at the hotel to enjoy the hospitality of Crispin & Choleta Pasia, proprietors of the STREETCAR BISTRO. I promise you will not be disappointed! The only "fly in the ointment" was the recommended tour that was most disappointing, so I urge the tourists to look this over carefully before handing over the fee. For the ladies traveling alone I can recommend this hotel as safe, comfortable, and clean. I will definitely book this hotel again & highly recommend it to my fellow travelors. Janice Russo

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Baronne. We had a great time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I, along with our two grown children and my Mother, stayed at the Baronne Plaza Hotel August 4 - 7. We got married that weekend and needed a decent, low priced hotel near the Quarter. I reserved 2 rooms, which were right next to each other. Both rooms were clean. The service was wonderful. The staff went out of their way to make sure all our needs were taken care of (making reservations, calling cabs for us, etc). The night manager went so far as to meet us outside the front door after we called to find out exactly where they were. Even my mom, who is very picky, loved the hotel. Needless to say, when we go back in November, we will stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good deal for the price. The front desk staff was helpful and friendly, and overall the hotel is clean. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: elsewhere1313
Reviews.Content: I will say I was a little worried after reading some of the reviews on this site but I was pleasantly surprised. The room was clean (a little small but that is what you expect from a room in the city) and the staff was accomodating. The only problem I had was that sometimes it took the valet a little longer than I would have liked to get my car for me. This was because there were 2 of them working but 1 of them was doing all of the work. Other than that, I would say it is a great hotel for the price. I was in town for a wedding and spent half as much on my room as all my other friends spent on theirs, and their rooms were not any better. Great location and it was very quiet! I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wakey77
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in the Baronne Plaza and it was excellent. Very reasonably priced. Reasonably sized rooms which were always clean. Located 5 mins walk from Bourbon Street in what felt like a very safe area. Free internet access was a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay! Would recommend to Everyone”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wow, minutes to Harrah's and to Bourbon Street? Clean rooms with courteous staff? This is the place for you! For under $100 this place is THE place to stay near the French Quarter. Can't say enough about it! When you book online, they even send an email welcoming you and when you check out they send you a thank you email! Thanks again Baronne!

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Baronne Plaza for the past three years during Jazz Fest. It's location is close to the French Quarter, streetcar, and 24 hour Walgreens. I have had no problems with noise, staff or cleanliness. This was my tenth time to New Orleans and believe me it is find in a city of steadily rising hotel prices.

Reviews.Title: “Ripped Off by the Baronne Plaza Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The service was terrible. I checked out the first night that I stayed there. Due to the fact that the trip was booked through Expedia, and due to the fact that the hotel claimed that I stayed there the whole trip, I was never refunded my money.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in the week leading up to Jazzfest in April. Seriously, I can't understand the negative reviews that have been posted here, because the Baronne was one of the nicest hotels we stayed at ANYWHERE in the US. Sure, a lot of the rooms don't have outside windows, but that was a bonus for us - kept out the street noise and the light in the mornings! Not that there was any street noise - it's just far away enough from Bourbon St to be nice and quiet, but close enought to be convenient. And as someone else pointed out, the 24hr Walgreens a block away is a definite bonus. No complaints at all about cleanliness or housekeeping - our room was cleaned every day, and when the flush lever on our toilet broke, it was fixed within an hour of us telling them. Architecturally, I loved it! The restaurant attached is great, more than just a cafe. And the desk staff we dealt with were all absolutely lovely (especially Kathleen), and did everything they could to help, booking tours for us and calling to sort out a problem we had with the airport shuttle at 4 a.m.! It felt like a much more expensive hotel to us, and we won't hesitate to stay here again. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Baronne at all costs...”
Reviews.Author: MCarroll95
Reviews.Content: I normally do not write reviews for anything, but my experience at the Baronne was so terrible, that I want to warn anyone that may be considering this as an option for a New Orleans trip ! I stayed there for Mardi Gras in 2004. I have stayed in approximately 10 different New Orleans hotels on my visits to the Big Easy. This is the worst - by far. I understand that most hotels use wristbands during Mardi Gras, and I have never had a problem with this. When we checked in on Thursday, the wristbands were not ready, we were told to come back later. I went and obtained mine the next day, but the front desk staff would not let me get the ones for my 3 friends that were listed guests in the room as they had to get them for themselves. * When my friends tried to get them later, they were told that the replacement fee was $50 per wristband, even though they had never picked up the original. The desk personnel threatened to call the cops if we tried to enter our hotel without the wristbands. Luckily they were horribly understaffed and had no way of preventing access to the hotel. The valet was also horrible, it took 40 minutes to retrieve my vehicle on Friday morning. * In summary, stay at the Alexa or Marriott, they are both great. * If you are looking for low prices for a room, you are better off to take a cab to Metarie or sleep on the street. They could not pay me to come back !!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: Traciwithaneye
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Baronne Plaza this past week and enjoyed my stay very much. The room was large and clean with nice windows. The hotel is very unique on the outside and has incredible architectural details on the inside, (stained glass, marble, etc.) The staff was very helpful and friendly. The bistro downstairs has great food. Being located only 1 1/2 blocks from the quarter made this hotel the best deal for the money. We paid $69 a night, Tues.-Thurs. Well lit, safe neighborhood so that we could walk back and forth to the quarter. Not a very fancy place, but who goes to New Orleans to hang out at the hotel? Perfect for the budget traveler.

Reviews.Title: “very simple and clean room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights with my spouse and the room was clean, quiet, and simple. Not much to complain about since we weren't looking to pay over $100 a night for a room but we never expected that at $70 a night, we were getting a good bargain because the rooms were overall well kept! I'm already thinking about staying at the Baronne next year for Mardi Gras because it's in a good location, and it's not pricey like the Fairmont (don't even get me started on that hotel!!). I would definitely recommend it to occupants who want a simple, clean, and a good priced room. And as for the negative feedback by others on tripadvisor, maybe it just wasn't your luck....but it sure was mine!! =P

Reviews.Title: “Avoid This Place”
Reviews.Author: SeenItAllCougar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Baronne Plaza several days in February, 2005. This hotel is poorly managed and it shows in different many ways. Rooms don't get made-up. The exercise room is never vacuumed. The lobby restroom is a leaking disaster. Most of the rooms are small and windowless. The decor is early Days Inn (because that's what the Baronne Plaza was originally, a Days Inn.). With a few notable exceptions (Leonard being one of them) the staff is borderline incompetent. The architecture/design of the Baronne Plaza is odd and not appealing. But the location is very good. So, avoid this place unless all that you need is just a place to sleep that 2 blocks from the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having seen a lot of reviews on each extreme of the spectrum, I was very concerned about staying at this hotel. The hotel is 2 blocks from Bourbon St. and has all the bells and whistles that you'd expect from a budget hotel. If you're looking for a 4 star hotel (or a high-end 3 star), move along. But if you simply want a clean room with a bed, this is a good choice -- assuming that you can get a rate somewhere south of $100/night. Biggest complaint is that the ironing board in the room was a miniature table-top model.

Reviews.Title: “I will stay here next time.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Was just there 2/11 thru 2/14/05. Very nice hotel. Clean, comfortable, and close to everything. We stayed for $95/night for Fri and Sat and $70 for Sun.

HotelInfo.Name: Wyndham Garden Hotel Baronne Plaza
HotelInfo.Address: 201 Baronne Street, New Orleans, LA 70112
